She wants to buy 12 large boxes of tomatoes, okra, garlic, cabbages, and eggplants. She plans on reinvesting her earnings in her business.

Mariam hopes to one day buy a piece of land and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 12 large boxes of tomatoes, okra, garlic, cabbage, and eggplant

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Jameela is a 37-year-old married woman. For many years, she has been successfully running a business of milk sales in her community. Over time, Jameela has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She hasa good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Jameela is a mother of three and is responsible for fulfilling their basic necessities of life. She also deals in goat sales to generate an extra amount of revenue. Jameela has some savings and applied a loan of PKR 25,000 through the Kashf Foundation to purchase another cow. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Ma Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Ma Isabel es una mujer con muchas fuerzas, mucha alegría y muchos deseos de salir adelante con 43 años de edad, casada y agricultora desde muy joven que en compañía de su esposo cultivan maíz y frijol. De ella no depende nadie y no tiene ningún grado de educación escolar. Ella tiene 18 años de dedicarse a esta actividad siendo sus clientes las bodegas, pulperías del mercado local. En dicha actividad solo se involucra ella, su esposo y un hijo el cual ayuda con la siembra, limpia y recolección de la cosecha.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a COMIXMUL el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a sus cultivos a fortalecerse y evitara que sean contaminados y dañados por bichos entre otros. 

Los planes a futuro de Doña Ma Isabel son comprar un pedazo de tierra y extender sus cultivos logrando obtener una buena cantidad la cual ayude a comercializar en una escala mayor y llegar a sectores donde aún no llega por la falta de producto.
texts.en:
María Isabel’s a very strong, very cheerful woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s 43-years-old, married and has worked in agriculture since she was very young.  She and her husband grow corn and beans.  She’s not dependent on anyone and has never gone to school.  She’s been in this activity for 18 years and her customers are stores and grocery stores in the local market.  She does all the chores with her husband and son who help with the planting, weeding and harvesting.

She’s asked Comixmul for a loan to buy agricultural supplies that will help her strengthen the crops avoiding their becoming contaminated and damaged by pests among others.

María Isabel’s future plan is to buy parcels of land and extend her crops obtaining a good amount so she can sell in larger scale and reach sectors she hasn’t gotten to yet for lack of product.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Rasheedan

texts.en:
Rasheedan, age 51, is a married woman. She is involved in the business of sewing shoe uppers. She supplies these uppers to different factories, where they are used in making shoes. By this time, she has developed a good customer list and makes enough profit to contribute to the family income.

In order to meet orders on time, she needs to purchase cloth and leather materials, with some spools of thread in various colors. For this reason, she applied for a loan of Rs. 45,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction, as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making shoe uppers, including cloth and leather, and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of four children.  She is doing a business of selling bed covers with her husband for many years. The man shown in the photo is her husband who purchases a wide variety of bed covers in bulk from the market.  Kousar sells them to the people of her community at reasonable prices and earns enough to support a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy more varieties of bed covers, sheets and spreads in various colors and designs. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good loan history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bed covers, sheets and spreads in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Divinas Fortalezas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DIVINAS FORTALEZAS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, atención de internet, venta de batidos y carnicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chamarras; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás por iniciativa de su esposo que trabajo en este rubro desde adolescente, en la actualidad ambos trabajan en el taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Divinas Fortalezas” (Divine Fortresses) communal bank will start the third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It consists of six members led by a governing board presided over by Cristina.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses among which are: jacket sewing, Internet access, blended drink sales and butcher shop.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Cristina.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for four years having joined thanks to an invitation from one of e institution’s promoters that visited her at home.  She currently has a business selling jackets and she relates that she learned this business several years ago on her husband’s initiative; he’d been in this line of work since he was an adolescent.  Currently  they both work in the shop.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy fabric at wholesale from supply stores in the city of El Alto and after manufacturing them will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to earn income to support her home as well as possible since she’s married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Luceros De Los Andes Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCERO DE LOS ANDES II”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: colchones de lana, venta de calzados, venta de frutas, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás de su madre a quien le ayudaba a vender, posteriormente decide emprender su propio espacio de comercialización, en el que trabaja hasta el momento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el crédito.
texts.en:
The  “LUCERO DE LOS ANDES II” [Star of the Andes II] Communal Bank is applying for a second loan from the  Los Andes Regional Office of Pro Mujer [Pro Woman]. LUCERO DE LOS ANDES II consists of eight members and is managed by a governing board led by the Chairwoman, Victoria. The members run various businesses, including wool textiles and the sale of shoes, fruits and other foods, and cosmetics. 

The loan that the LUCERO DE LOS ANDES members are applying for will benefit the small businesswomen in the group. Victoria explains that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago at the invitation of a representative from the institution who came to her home. Victoria's mother taught her to sell vegetables several years ago, and Victoria at first helped her mother. Victoria then decided to set up her own place of business, where she works now. 

This loan will increase capital for the purchase of vegetables at markets in the city of El Alto. Victoria will then sell this produce sell at her place of business. Selling vegetables allows Victoria to earn income for household expenses. She is married and has a son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Victoria answers that she likes the training and loans.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Colque Patha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COLQUE PATHA”  iniciará el vigésimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Estefa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de galletas, confección de polleras, atención de punto de llamadas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Estefa es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de atención de punto de llamadas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás desde su ingreso a Pro Mujer, al observar que era un buen negocio lo emprendió en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tarjetas telefónicas por mayor) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Colque Patha” communal bank will start the 28th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Estefa.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: grocery store, clothes sales, food sales, cookie sales, skirt making and call center.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Estefa.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for ten years having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a call center and says she learned this business years ago when she joined Pro Mujer; noting that it was a good business she started it in her zone.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy phone cards at wholesale from suppliers in the city of El Alto and then resell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to earn income to support her home however possible since she’s married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy phone cards at wholesale.

loans.name: Fifi Group

texts.en:
Nadine is the featured borrower of Fifi group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. Their acquired loan is very important for developing their businesses, and their socioeconomic situations.
Nadine is a 25-year-old married mother of one child. She has worked as a makeup artist and facial expert at her house for a year and a half.
She is a hard worker who seeks perfection in her business and in pleasing to customers. The loan will be invested in buying new summer beauty cosmetics and make up, in addition to newly-released tools specialized for facial treatment. She is the one sitting in the middle.
Liliane is the one sitting on the left. She works in tailoring and knitting beads for wedding dresses and dresses for special occasions. She is a 23-year-old single lady who is working hard to develop her business by buying necessary beads and threads in addition to several other related accessories.
Fadwa is the one at the right side of the picture. She is a 22-year-old single lady who works selling plastic house products. Through the acquired loan she is planning to increase her merchandise with new released items.

loans.use: to buy new summer beauty cosmetics and make up.

loans.name: Wiñay Marka Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WIÑAY MARKA”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eva María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de macramé, venta de shampoo, elaboración y venta de cotillones, venta de productos YAMBAL, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eva María es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de atención de venta de comida (pensión); cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su esposo hace varios observando que existía un buen mercado para este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el equipamiento de su espacio de comercio (compra de mesas) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Wiñay Marka communal bank will begin its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Andes Regional Office. It is composed of nine members and is led by a governing board, of which Señora Eva María is President. The businesses of the communal bank's members are varied, and include, among others: making macrame textiles, selling shampoo, making and selling party favours, selling YAMBAL cosmetic products, and providing transportation services.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business owners like Señora Eva María. She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer eight cycles ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who was a member of the institution. Today, she sells food through her small restaurant business; she took up this business jointly with her husband several years ago, observing that there was a good market for it.

The loan that she is taking out now is to equip her place of business (purchasing tables) that she will acquire from distributors in the city of El Alto and later install in her premises. This work permits her to generate income to maintain her household as well as possible, as she is married and has one son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health care area.

loans.use: to purchase tables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy wood and a woodcutter for a furniture-making business

loans.name: Safae

texts.en:
Safae is a 30-year-old divorced mother who works hard to fulfill her two children’s needs, and struggles to keep them happy and satisfied with her hard work. She lives to keep her children in her warm, loving home and within eyesight.

Safae has been selling cosmetics and perfumes for seven years, and it is her only source of income. She has been an Al Majmoua borrower for six cycles with a good repayment history.

Today, Safae is requesting a YOUTH loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new perfume and cosmetics in order to have good and exciting offerings for the summer. She hopes to expand her business and open her own shop instead of going from one place to another to sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy new perfume and cosmetics

loans.name: Benkadi   Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  BENKADI  VI sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Massoukou un des villages de Dioila, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, du mil. Elles sont à leur quatrième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Mamine  1 ère à droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice  de 125 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of "BENKADI VI" are married women, who average 30 years of age and three children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Massoukou, a village in Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are peanuts and millet. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. 

With this loan, Mamine, who is the first person standing from the right in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain about 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. After the harvest, the produce will be sold to men and women customers in Marka Coungo City. She hopes to make profit of about 125,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry equipment

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su familia, ella posee una pequeña tienda donde vende gaseosas, refrescos, golosinas, entre otros también se dedica a la venta de tortas y espumosos, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias,  está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su pequeña tienda y su negocio de tortas y espumosos, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The borrower lives in a house she owns with her family.  She has a small store where she sells sodas, soft drinks, snacks, and other items as well as selling sandwiches and blended fruit drinks.  She has done this work for many years, which has given her sales experience that allows her to earn more profits.  Her store is located in her home in a high traffic area of her town and it is well known among her neighbors in the area.  She has a large customer base.

She wants to expand her store and make a new investment but she needs capital, so she is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase the necessary items for her small store and her business selling sandwiches and blended fruit drinks.  

She is sure that she will repay the debt and believes that this will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase soda, soft drinks, snacks, bread for sandwiches, bananas, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, sus tres nietos y su hermano, ella se dedica a la  venta de frutas y verduras, sandia, plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; marina es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Marina tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Marina, 53, lives in her own house with her daughter, three grandchildren and her brother.  She works selling fruit and vegetables like watermelon, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions and chilies, among others.  She’s been in business for several years and has gained much sales experience that leads to the best profits.  The place where she sells is very strategic for this activity and lots of people come by.  She has a large clientele that prefers her because her product is fresh, at a good price and with excellent service. 

Marina’s an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and who very much wants to get ahead. She’s always looking for alternatives that will lead her to attain success.  

Demand has increased in recent weeks and she wants to take advantage of this and make a new investment but lacks enough capital to back her up which is why she’s requested a loan from Integral that will make it possible for her to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.

Marina has good payment references and is grateful for the support and assures that she’ll be able to repay the debt while at the same time is confident that she’ll be able to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: Maria de 40 años de edad vive en casa de un hermano con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella tiene una tienda donde vende frijoles, leche, huevos, pan,  jabones, detergentes, shampoo, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, Maria es una mujer  dedicada a su labor, como toda buena comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 40, lives in her brother’s house with her two children and her husband.  She has a store where she sells beans, milk, eggs, bread, soap, detergent and shampoo, among others.  She’s been in business for several years so she’s gained much sales experience that leads to earning the best profits.  It’s located at home which is in a very busy spot.  She’s gained a large clientele because she has the best stocked store.  People prefer her and keep her ahead of the competition because she always has what they need: quality products and accessible prices with unequaled service always at her customers’ service.

María is a woman who is dedicated to her work and like all good merchants wants to increase business and make a new investment but needs capital to do so which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, beverages, etc. to earn higher profits and give her family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Angela Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Ángela tiene 26 años de edad,  es una persona muy amable, vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación y tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en un barrio de Tegucigalpa.
Doña Ángela tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza de forma ambulante, sus clientes son la vecinos y amigos de la zona donde vive y también la distribuye en los mercados de la ciudad.
Doña Ángela necesita el préstamo para la compra de ropa como ser camisas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, calzonetas, etc. espera que con la inversión que realice en su negocio le ayude a obtener las ganancias para poder salir adelante con su familia.
Doña Ángela su sueño es tener siempre su negocio para poder sacar adelante a su familia y darle una buena educación a sus hijos.




Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Julio del 2013
texts.en:
Ángela, 26, is a very nice woman living in her house with her husband and two children who depend on her; she lives in a neighborhood in Tegucigalpa.

Ángela’s been selling used clothes for seven years; most of her sales are from place to place.  Her customers are neighbors and friends from the zone she lives in and she also sells in local markets in the city.

Ángela needs the loan to buy clothes like shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, blouses, swimming trunks, etc. and hopes that with the investment she’ll make in her business she’ll earn profits to get ahead with her family.

Ángela’s dream is to always have her business so she can move her family forward and provide good a good education for her children.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – July, 2013

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Roxana Guadalupe

texts.es: Roxana de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella  se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Roxana  solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Roxana is 32 years old. She lives in a house of her own with her two children and sells tortillas from home. She has been in this line of work for several years, and works from Monday to Sunday. Due to her willingness to work hard and her congeniality, she has a lot of customers. With the income she derives from the sales, she manages to pay for household expenses. Roxana asks for a loan to buy sweetcorn by the quintal and lime in order to keep making tortillas and increase her income so as to give her family greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy sweetcorn by the quintal and lime.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, es una mujer muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia.  Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, blanca desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y así ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Blanca lives in a house of her own with her husband and her three sons. She is a very responsible woman whose first priority is to help her family pull through. She sells tortillas, which she makes for lunchtime and for dinner. Her shop is located at her home. Blanca wishes to improve her business, since it generates a very stable income, which enables her to support her family. Thus, she asks for a loan to buy sweetcorn wholesale and lime in order to make more tortillas, particularly on week-ends, which is when she has the most customers, since many other similar establishments are closed. Blanca's goal is to increase her income so as to improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy sweetcorn wholesale and lime.

loans.name: Maria Transito

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con su familia, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia cerca del punto de buses desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, Maria desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: María lives in a house of her own with her family. She is full of fighting spirit and a very responsible woman who does all she can so that her family can find sustenance. She has been selling food near a bus stop close to her house for several years. Her fair prices guarantee her a solid customer base. María wishes to improve her food stall by buying tables, chairs, and ingredients (such as rice, chicken, meat, vegetables, and fruit) in order to offer more types of dishes and increase her income. Since, however, she lacks the necessary funds for this investment, she asks for a loan to buy these things, in order to increase her income and provide for basic necessities for her family.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, perfumes, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos,  la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, cremas ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles, con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The borrower works selling all type of personal care products such as lotions, deodorants, creams, and perfumes.  Her business is located in her home.  The income she earns from her sales and the help of her husband are able to meet all of the household expenses.  She lives in a house she owns with her husband and their children.

The borrower wants to expand her business and is requesting this loan to be able to purchase all of the necessary items such as perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, and creams.  She has many customers to buy her products at affordable prices.  With the requested help she will be able to earn more profits and continue giving her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, and creams.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria vive con su hija en casa alquilada, ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; María es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, ella quiere hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor y cal. María tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her daughter in a rented home.  She has a tortilla making business that is very well known in the area where she lives.  She has many customers since she sells the best tortillas with the fastest service at affordable prices.  Maria is an enterprising woman who wants to succeed.  

She wants to grow her business, so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase corn at wholesale and lime powder.  Maria hopes that this will allow her to bring her household financial security and give her family a full life.

loans.use: to purchase corn at wholesale and lime powder.

loans.name: Maria Clementina

texts.es: Maria vive con su hijo en casa propia, se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería pasta dental, guacales, papel higiénico, jabón, etc. por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y darle a su hijo una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her son in her own house. She sells cleaning products as a street vendor in different neighbourhoods near where she lives. With her earnings she is able to pay for some household expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to purchase more wholesale merchandise, such as toothpaste, crates, toilet paper, soap, etc., to maintain her business and provide more financial security for her son.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale merchandise such as toothpaste, crates, toilet paper, soap, etc.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Koem is 42 years old and a resident of the Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. To make a living, she cultivates the land for growing rice and also raises some poultry at her yard to supplement her income. Her region is famous for growing rice, beans, corn, cassava, and vegetables. For more than 30 years, she has been enjoying agriculture, and earns a net income of KHR 20,000 per day. 

Koem is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs and pay the cost of labor for plowing her rice paddy. This investment will help increase her bean production and the profits earned will be used to continue supporting the family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay the cost of labor for plowing her rice paddy.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
This is Nora, 40, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Saaban, a vendor, and they have children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nora operates the retail business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes. Customers are attracted due to the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products like polo shirts for men and women, socks, and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Nora dreams of having a permanent stall in the market and hopes to have her own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise like men and women's ready to wear items

loans.name: Zeneida

texts.es:
Zeneida es una mujer emprendendedora , con grandes deseos de superación y se ve obligada a emigrar de la zona rural a la ciudad ,viniéndose para San José. Una vez instalada busca aprender un oficio para poder generar ingresos,hace un curso básico de belleza e inicia su negocio . Por razones personales tuvo que suspenderlo un tiempo, hace tres años lo retoma en forma definitiva.
Ella se traslada a vivir a Cartago,compra una vivienda, y aprovechando que tiene un espacio libre quiere instalar su salita,ya que actualmente por no contar con las condiciones realiza la mayor parte de su trabajo a domicilio. 
La clienta manifiesta que su gran obstáculo es no contar con el recurso económico para realizar su inversión, pero con el crédito podrá dar un mejor servicio de calidad a su clientela.Mejorar su crecimiento personal y apoyar económicamente al presupuesto familiar y en el futuro poder generar empleo a otras mujeres de su comunidad.

Zeneida , vive con su esposo y con sus tres hijos, quienes son menores de edad y estudiantes, por ello la actividad económica que ella realiza es muy importante , porque le permite apoyar gastos de estudio de sus hijos y darles mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Zenaida’s an enterprising woman who very much wants to improve.  She was forced to emigrate from a rural zone into the city and came to San José.  Once settled she sought to learn an income-generating occupation.  She took a basic beauty course and started her business.  Because of personal reasons she had to suspend it for a time and three years ago took it up again on a permanent basis.

She went to live in Cartago, bought a house and taking advantage of some free space in it she wants to set up her small salon because at present not having the proper set-up forces her to do most of her work in customers’ homes.

She states that her great obstacle is not having economic resource to make her investment but with the loan she will be able provide better customer service.  Her personal growth will improve and she will support her family budget economically and in future will be able to provide employment for other women in her community.

Zenaida lives with her husband and three children who are minors and students.  Because of this the economic activity she does is very important because it makes it possible for her to help with her children’s schooling costs and to give them better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Amro

texts.en: Amro is 21 years old. He lives in Karak, Jordan with his family, which consists of five members. He is currently studying to attain his Bachelor of Mechanical Engineering. He is in his third year and is also working at the same time in farming with his father. He is planning to gain experience by working in his field of study after graduation. As Amro is currently facing financial problems, he is requesting a loan that covers his education fees.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees.

loans.name: Channat's Group

texts.en:
Channat is 38 years old and a mother of three children. Currently, only one of her sons is in school. 

To strive for a living, Channat grows rice on two hectares of farmland. She has been involved in the current business for 20 years, earning about KHR 25,000 per day. 

This is the original loan for Channat with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She joins a group of two, to apply for a new loan. She is applying for KHR 800,000, while her co-borrower is applying for KHR 300,000.  

As the group's leader, Channat will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes to boost her crops in a timely manner and to gain a greater yield than before.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a maize milling machine that will provide a food milling service to over 1000 members in her community

loans.name: Asman

texts.en:
Asman is a 23-year-old, married woman. She has been doing a business of carpet manufacturing for the past 15 years. She works hard on her weaver every day, so she may earn a living for her family. She offers various handmade carpets and has become famous for providing good-quality carpets in her circle. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. 

For the improvement of her business, Asman contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers, to increase her sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers, to increase her sales.

loans.name: Hin's Group

texts.en:
A mother in her early 60s and a villager from Battambang province, Hin has seven children. 

To deal with her family’s cost of living, she does rice cultivation on four hectares of land as her primary source of income. She has occupied her business since she was 43 years old. Now, her current income is KHR 33,300 per day.  

With VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner), Hin is a seven-time borrower and La, her joint borrower in the same group, is a first-time borrower. Hin has repaid her past loan wisely to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. 

Now, Hin is seeking a loan for KHR 200,000 to buy household appliances for her family. She hopes that she can provide sufficient housing for her children.

loans.use: to buy household appliances for her family.

loans.name: Gagawala Kirombe Dev't Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a single mother with four children, three of which are school going. She sells charcoal and is so passionate about it because she has been able to earn money from it to look after her four children.

However, she also has a side income of manufacturing liquid soap locally which has helped her to improve on her income. She applied for the loan of UGX 400,000 in order to improve her business of liquid soap making so as to increase the profits. She is a hardworking lady and God fearing. She hopes to borrow more money from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd as time goes by. She is so grateful for the services Ugafode has provided to her. The third person seated in the middle front is the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making liquid soap.

loans.name: José Atilio

texts.es:
José tiene 50 años de edad, es casado. Es una persona humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y sorgo aprendió esta labor desde muy pequeño con su padre y sus hermanos madrugando y trabajando todo el día. Además aprendió el oficio de albañilería y dedica el mayor tiempo al trabajo de construcción. En la época de verano generando ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Ahora en día él enseña a sus hijos a cultivar y a trabajar desarrollando las habilidades del oficio que sabe hacer y de esta manera enseña a sus hijos a ganar su propio dinero y para que en el futuro puedan defenderse desempeñando un trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 8 sacos de abono y otros productos como herbicidas para el control de malezas del cultivo. Así, plantar una buena milpa y obtener una buena producción en la cosecha. Para adquirir estos insumos debe viajar en pick-up una distancia de 16 kilómetros para llegar hasta el lugar donde encuentra los productos que necesita.
 
En este momento la milpa necesita del fertilizante para lograr obtener la producción proyectada, y así tenga la oportunidad de cultivar los granos básicos para el consumo de su familia. Y así el cliente podrá dedicarse a sus cultivos que es lo que desde niño realiza, y es una forma de generar ingresos a su familia, ya que en el año pasado la producción solo sirvió para solventar otras necesidades financieras pero con el  apoyo que hoy le brinda fundación campo, podrá sembrar sus granos básicos y obtener el alimento de su familia como también un ingreso para cubrir sus necesidades de sus hijos y esposa.

Él piensa en que después de pagar este crédito, sacar otro y destinarlo a la compra de materiales para construir un muro en su casa donde vive, él mismo se encargaría de hacerlo y cubrir una de las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
José is 50 and married with children. He is a humble and hardworking man who grows corn, beans, and sorghum. José's father and siblings taught him to do farm labor when he was a small boy. José rose early with his family and worked all day with them. He later learned construction and spends most of his time working in that sector.

José earns income in summer that supports his family. He's now teaching his children to farm and do construction work so they'll be able to support themselves and earn a living through work.  

José is applying for a loan from the Fundación Campo [Campo Foundation] to purchase eight bags of manure and other supplies such as herbicides for weed control. The loan funds will allow José to plant a good corn crop and achieve a good yield at harvest time. He'll have to travel 16 kilometers in a pickup truck to purchase the supplies. 

The corn crop currently needs fertilizer to reach José's projected production and allow him to grow staple grains for his family to eat. With this fertilizer, José will be able to work his crops as he's done since he was a child and earn an income for his family. Last year's harvest only met other financial needs. With the support José is receiving now from the Fundación Campo, however, he'll be able to plant basic grains and provide his family with food as well as income to meet the needs of his wife and children. 

After José pays off this loan, he'll apply for another one and use those funds to purchase building materials for a wall in his house. He plans to do this project himself and take care of one of his family's needs.

loans.use:
para comprar 8 sacos de abono y otros productos como herbicidas para el control de malezas del cultivo.

to purchase eight bags of manure and other products such as herbicides for weed control.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been running a business of cloth sales for many years. She purchases a variety of embroidered and printed cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Noreen requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through more sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth types for the summer season.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, Abla est une femme qui habite le quartier Adidogomé. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle a commencé le petit commerce depuis son enfant et a acquis beaucoup d’expérience auprès de sa maman qui est une revendeuse des produits génériques. 
En 2011, elle a décidé de créer sa propre petite entreprise de restauration à la devanture de sa maison. Vu qu’elle n’a pas assez de moyen, elle a démarré par la vente des boules d’akassan « Akpan ». Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché d’Adidogomé.
Vu l’engouement qu’il y a au tour de son petit commerce l’idée lui est venu d’y associer la restauration du haricot. Son activité marche bien puisqu’elle intègre les formations économiques et sociales qu’elle reçoit auprès de ASSILASSIME dans ses pratiques quotidiennes. 

Ce crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter  2 sacs de charbon de bois, 10 bol du haricot et 1 bidon d’huile végétale.
texts.en:
Abla is married, has four children, and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood. She is 37 years of age, and has worked in small-scale retail since she was a child. She gained a lot of experience from her mother, who is a reseller of general products.

In 2011 Abla decided to create her own small food business in front of her home. As she did not have enough resources, she started off by just selling akassa or akpan [steamed balls of fermented corn mush]. She gets her supplies in Adidogomé market. Due to the enthusiasm for her business in the area, Abla had the idea of starting to also sell beans. Her business is doing well, as she has integrated the financial and social education she received from Assilassime into her daily practices. The loan she has requested will allow her to buy two bags of charcoal, ten bowls of beans and one drum of vegetable oil.

loans.use: To buy two bags of charcoal, ten bowls of beans and one drum of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: At the age of 34, Naheed is an energetic married woman. She is doing a business of art framing with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She purchases a number of paintings from the market and after framing them her husband sells them in their locality. Their immense experience in the art of glass framing has given them the ability to meet their clients' needs. To buy more frames and glass in different sizes with some colorful paintings, she requested a loan of PKR  35,000 from the Kashf Foundation. It’s her second loan cycle; she expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more frames and glass in different sizes with some colorful paintings.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi a 32ans et a 2 enfants. Elle est une femme mariée qui réside à Agoè Assigomé dans une maison en terre battue recouverte de tôles. 

En 2003, elle a commencé au marché d'Agoè son commerce de condiments et est spécialisé dans la vente des oignons.  Son activité évolue bien et elle s’approvisionne 2 fois par semaine au grand marché de Lomé.

Pour agrandir son stock d’oignons, elle sollicite un prêt qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour mieux nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 32 years old and has two children. She is a married woman who lives in Agoè Assigomé in a house made of sun-dried mud bricks with a corrugated tin roof. 

In 2003, she began her business selling condiments at the market at Assiyéyé and has specialized in selling onions. Her business is going well and she buys more stock twice a week at the Grand Market in Lomé.

To expand her stock of onions, she is asking for a loan which will allow her to grow her income so as to feed her family better.

loans.use: to buy one sack of onions

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 41 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo, sus 2 hijos y 2 nietos. Martha se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas y parrilladas en su propia casa, ya que se instalan en el frontis de su casa donde ponen una mesa todos los fines de semana y venden sus parrilladas, realizando estas actividades con el apoyo de sus hijos desde hace 06 años. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera los ingresos económicos que necesita para pagar sus gastos de su hoga. Desea continuar trabajando y mantener su negocio ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones económicas y personales. Esto es su primer préstamo con Kiva, se siente agradecida  por el apoyo de contar con una línea de crédito para continuar con sus negocios. Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de bebidas de diversos sabores para así tener mayores ingresos y además invertir en las parrilladas.
texts.en:
Martha is forty-one years old, is married, and lives in the house that she owns together with her husband, two children, and two grandchildren.  Martha makes a living selling carbonated beverages and barbecue from her home.  They have set up an area at the front of the house where they have a table every weekend and where they sell barbecued items.  She has been doing this for six years with the help and support of her children.

She likes this business because it generates the economic income that she needs in order to cover the home expenses.  She hopes to continue working and maintaining her business, since it has brought her a lot of economic and personal satisfaction.

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She feels thankful for the loan credit in order to continue with her business.  With the requested loan amount (1000 soles), she will invest in the purchase of beverages (all different flavors) so that she can increase her income.  She will also invest in her barbecue stand.

loans.use: to buy drinks of various flavors, and to invest in her barbecue stand.

loans.name: Central Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CENTRAL SANTA ROSA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Roxana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de tunta, producción de leche, producción de papa, venta de ganado, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Roxana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio por cuando aprendió la técnica de tejido, posteriormente decide implementar su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Central Santa Rosa” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Roxana as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as producing dehydrated white potatoes, producing milk, cultivating potatoes, selling livestock, selling cosmetics, selling food, and selling blankets.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Roxana. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a promoter of the organization who visited her house. Roxana currently has a business of selling blankets. She gained knowledge about this business after she learned the skill of weaving. It was at that point that she decided to start her own business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool. Roxana acquires the wool at fairs in the city of El Alto and then uses it to make the requested products that she sells. Working in this manner enables her to sustain her household. She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Roxana says that she enjoys the training seminars.

loans.use: to buy wool for making blankets.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 49 años es un padre responsable , esta casado con Rosa con quien tiene una hija. Jose se dedica a confeccionar gorros y sombreros pero ahora desea incursionar en la confección de polos, por ello espera comprar una máquina que le abrirá las puertas en este proyecto. El trabaja muy duro en la confección de estos gorros  publicitarios para ferreterías, grifos y veterinarias, ya tiene 11 años dedicándose a esto y comenta que cuando comenzó en este negocio, llevaba a vender sus gorros a las ferias de las diferentes ciudades del país, con el tiempo le hacían pedidos los comerciantes mayoristas, ahora solo trabaja para empresas. Obtiene buenas ganancias con la venta de sus productos, pues es un hombre trabajador y responsable. “tengo que luchar para terminar de pagar los estudios universitarios de mi hija y que sea una gran profesional”, comenta. Este es su quinto crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. José invertirá los S/. 3500 soles en la compra de una máquina de confección, para realizar los acabados de polos.
texts.en:
José, 49, is a responsible father, and is married to Rosa with whom he has a daughter. José sews winter and summer hats, but now wants to begin sewing tshirts. To do so, he hopes to purchase a machine that will open the door to this project. 

He works very hard in the production of these promotional hats for hardware stores, gas stations, and veterinarians, and he has been doing this work for 11 years. He says that when he started his business, he brought his hats to sell at markets in different cities across the country, but over time he received orders from wholesale merchants, and now he works only for businesses. He makes a good income through the sale of his products, as he is a hard-working and responsible man. "I must struggle to finish paying for my daughter's university studies so that she can be a big professional," he says. 

This is his fifth loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the support that he receives to get ahead in life. As well, he is committed to paying his dues punctually. José will invest the 3500 soles in the purchase of a sewing machine to make finished tshirts.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Lorenzo es técnico electrónico , este oficio le enseñó su padre y gracias a este empezó a ganarse la vida en una zona donde prácticamente era un desconocido pero por su buen trato y honradez fue ganándose el cariño y confianza de la gente. El mayor de sus hijos es un gran apoyo ya que aprendió desde muy niño el oficio familiar y lo considera su mano derecha. Desde el inicio de sus labores siempre estableció su negocio en distintos locales y eso le permitió hacerse muy querido y conocido por los pobladores del lugar. A medida que iba ahorrando sus ingresos, logró comprar un juego de equipo estereofónico que alquila para eventos sociales y deportivos generándole buenos ingresos. Se siente muy a gusto con su labor ya que gracias a ello puede mantener a su familia económicamente y además tiene muchos objetivos a largo plazo, como el colocar una tienda de artefactos. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para los artefactos electrónicos que suele reparar esperando estar siempre al servicio de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is fifty-one years old, and lives together with his wife and their children in the house that they own.  Lorenzo is an electronics technician.  His father taught him this trade.  Thanks to that, he began earning a living in an area where he was practically unknown.  However, because of his kindness and honesty, he has won the affection and trust of the people.  The eldest of his children is a great support.  He learned this family trade from a very young age, and Lorenzo considers him to be his right-hand man.  

From the beginning, he has always established his business in different areas.  This has allowed him to make himself very loved and well-known among the inhabitants of the town.  By saving his income, he was able to buy a set of stereo equipment that he rents out for social and sporting events.  This generates great extra revenue.  He feels very much at ease with his work.  Thanks to his labor, he can economically maintain his family.  He also has many long-term objectives, like opening an appliances store.  

This is his second loan with Kiva, and he feels thankful for the financial support he has received in order to continue moving forward.  On this occasion, he is asking for 3,000 soles.  He will purchase spare parts for the types of electrical household appliances that he usually repairs.  He hopes to always be at the service of his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for electrical household appliances.

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ Y VIDA”  iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Venancia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos artesanales, venta de lubricantes, taller de canaletas, venta de refrescos, venta de ropa, servicio de tapicería, confección de calzados, venta de salchipapas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Venancia es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás con el apoyo de su esposo que elabora estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de plantillas, cuero y enseries) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Luz y Vida” (Light and Life) communal bank will start the ninth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Venancia.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: crafts sales, lubricant sales, gutter making, soft-drink sales, clothes sales, upholstery service, shoe-making and ‘salchipapa’ [fried sausages with fried potatoes] sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Venancia.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for ten years having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling shoes.  She relates that she learned this business years ago with help from her husband who manufactures these items.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy insoles, leather and supplies from suppliers in the city of La Paz and once they are manufactured will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home as possible since she’s married and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings and the credit.

loans.use: to buy insoles, leather and supplies.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos con quienes vive en una casa construida a base de madera. Cuando fue joven y al tener a su primera hija dejo de lado las actividades en el campo y junto a su esposo  puso una tienda de abarrotes en su hogar para brindarle un cuidado adecuado a su pequeña hija y generar sus propios ingresos. Cuando comenzó colocó algunos andamios de madera y compró poca mercadería para probar suerte y tras algunos días  logró venderlos inmediatamente siendo este el motivo para dedicarse más a este negocio y surtirlo con más  mercadería para mejorar sus ganancias. Día a día recibe la visita de sus clientes quienes son vecinos y amigos suyos a quienes ofrece víveres de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, harina, golosinas, entre otros. Para obtener mejores ganancias compra la mercadería que ofrece al por mayor logrando obtener buenos precios y también mantener su negocio siempre abastecido. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta ocasión contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de sacos de arroz y paquetes de gaseosa que son de buena demanda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna, 35, is the mother of two children she lives with in a wooden house.  When she was young and had her first daughter she left field work aside and she and her husband opened a grocery store at home so she could care for her little daughter while generating income of her own.  

When she started out she set up some wood shelving and bought a little merchandise to try her luck and after a few days managed to sell it immediately.  This motivated her to go into the business more and to stock it with more merchandise to improve her profits.  

Her customers who are her neighbors and friends visit her day to day; she offers them basic staple food items like rice, flour and snacks, among others. To earn higher profits she buys the merchandise she offers at wholesale getting better prices and to keep her store stocked always.  

This is her second Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she receives to continue forward; she commits to make her payments punctually.  On this occasion, she’d like to have 2,000 new soles to buy sacks of rice and packages of soft-drinks which are in high demand in her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and packages of soft-drinks.

loans.name: Angoritas 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGORITAS 25 DE JULIO”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Janeth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, venta de chicharron, venta de ropa, venta de muebles, tienda de barrio, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Janeth es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa de su madre, que trabaja en el mismo rubro, quien le enseñó la forma de negocio que debe establecer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las ferias distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ANGORITAS 25 DE JULIO”  is beginning its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional center. It is made up of nine members and led by a directive board, with Janeth as President. The businesses operated by the members of this communal bank are diverse, including: blanket weaving, fried pork sales, clothing sales, furniture sales, a neighborhood store, and a grocery store. 

The loan for which they are applying will benefit small enterprises such as that of the member Janeth. She reports that she has been with Pro Mujer for three loan cycles, joining on the invitation of a promoter of the institution who came to visit her in her home. Currently, she has a business selling clothing. She says that she started this business thanks to the initiative of her mother, who works in the same field, and who taught her about the kind of business she should establish. 

The loan she will receive now is to increase her capital by buying clothing. She will acquire it at the distribution markets of the city of El Alto, and later she will sell it at her sales stand. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as well as possible, since she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health office.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Morena Cesibel

texts.es: Morena de 52 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros desde  hace 30 años, tiene mucha clientela pues su mercadería es de muy buena calidad y a precios muy cómodos, además es muy amable, trabajadora y responsable, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su hijo, morena está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y así surtir su negocio y poder atender mejor a sus clientes y ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Morena, 52, has worked selling women’s and men’s clothing for 30 years.  She has a large clientele because her merchandise is very good quality and prices are very affordable.  She’s also nice, hardworking and responsible.  She uses her sales profits to cover some of her household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her son.

Morena is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise at wholesale to stock her business and provide better customer service thus earning higher profits to provide better quality for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Ghinwa

texts.en:
Ghinwa is a 26-year-old, married mother of one child. For nine years, she has been working as a hairdresser. Her salon is located in a high population region which is a good location to develop her business and work on increasing her income.

Ghinwa is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy a stand to display beauty cosmetics and newly-released tools.

This is Ghinwa's second loan cycle from Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development. Her previous loan helped her to develop her business and had a positive outcome. Today, Ghinwa is planning to keep on developing her business to make sure that her child will have the best living and education and, at the same time, ensuring that her customers are satisfied.

loans.use: to buy a stand to display beauty cosmetics and newly-released tools.

loans.name: German Francisco

texts.es: Germán de 46 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, de esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, Germán  ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar este crédito ya que la temporada en la que se realiza la siembra, se aproxima, y quiere estar preparado con los principales insumos agrícolas como: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes. Herramientas, etc. espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Germán is 46 years old and grows corn and beans. This is how he makes a living and is able to take home the daily bread. He carries out the sowing and harvesting every year and it is the only way he is able to make a living. He is a very hard-working, honorable, and responsible man. Despite the conditions he lives in, which are very humble, he never gets tired of working and tries to give his family the best. Germán has decided to approach the institution to request this loan because the sowing season is coming and he wants to be prepared by having the essential farming supplies, such as manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, and tools, etc. He hopes to get positive results since he does not have any other form of income. He trusts in God that his crops will produce an abundant harvest which will allow him to continue to put food on the table.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, and tools, etc.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia,  él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 32 años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida, la actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de cómo ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes, herramientas,  etc. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rafael, 52, lives in his own house.  He has worked growing corn and beans for 32 years.  This is how he earns his livelihood, an activity he does year to year and the only way he knows of earning a living.  

He’s a very hardworking, honest, responsible man.  Despite the conditions he lives in which are very humble he does not tire of working.  

He’s decided to request a loan to buy the main agricultural supplies: manure, poison for pests, seeds, fertilizer, tools, etc.  He hopes to get favorable results because he has no other source of income.  He trusts in God that he’ll get an abundant harvest that will make it possible for him to continue bringing daily bread home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Adriana Concepcion

texts.es: Adriana de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos de 17, 15 y 13 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas desde hace varios años frente al seguro que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Adriana esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar todos los ingredientes para poder elaborarles como: arroz, maíz, chicharrón, frijoles, quesillo, tomates, aceite, etc. para seguir con su negocio y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adriana, 39, lives in her own house with her three children. They are 17, 15, and 13 years old and are currently in school. She has a business selling pupusas (thick corn tortillas with various fillings), which she has sold for a number of years in front of the insurance building near where she lives. With her earnings, she manages to cover some of her household expenses.

Adriana is requesting a loan in order to purchase all of the ingredients to make pupusas, such as: rice, corn, chicharrón (pork rinds), beans, quesillo (soft cheese), tomatoes, oil, etc. to maintain her business and provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn, chicharrón (pork rinds), beans, quesillo (soft cheese), tomatoes, oil, etc.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus is fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. Jesus is asking for a loan to buy new engine for his fishing boat. With this he will be able to improve his fishing business and makes it a success.

loans.use: to buy new engine for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a 38-year-old lady from Manyatta location in Kisumu city which is found in the western part of Kenya. She supports one child who is 14 years of age. She is married to Mr. Fredrick who is employed and gives support to the family. 

She has a retail shop which has been operating for the last two years and gets a monthly income of KES 45,000. She is taking her third loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to boost her stock by purchasing items like bar soap, cooking oil and wheat flour. She will use the anticipated profit to increase her stock and pay school fees for her kid.

Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur and take good care of her family.

loans.use: To Increase her stock.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 27-year-old lady from a place called Rongo region, which is found in the Migori, Kenya. She is a mother and supports four people in her family. She is married to James, who is the founder of the business and supports the family. She has three kids who are 12, 9 and 7 years old.

Emily runs a hardware shop where she sells general goods. She has been running this business for the last 12 years and gets a monthly income of 25,000 KES. She is taking her second loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to purchase more goods from her suppliers.

Emily will put the anticipated profit back into the business.

Her dream is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Narghush

texts.en:
Narghush is 54 years old. She and her family live in the village of Lusahovit, which is in Ijevan district. She has four children; her three daughters are married and live separately, and her son is a student at Yerevan State University, Ijevan Branch, in the department of Tourism.

After her husband’s death, Narghush became very worried and doubly responsible for her children's living conditions and future. So she established her own business.
