Marie is 35-years-old and married with three children between the ages of 7 and 15. She runs a general stock in the Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She started operating her business after the war and she sells plastic rubber in her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is an improper business location.

Marie requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to become a fish seller. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to resell.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is in her early twenties and is single with a two-year-old child.  She runs a fish selling business in the Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. 

She's been in this business since she left school and she now sells fish within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well because from the profits she has been able to take care of her child and her mother.

Aminata requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more fish to resell.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase retail stock such as sacks of beans, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Dinora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dinora, vive con su familia, su madre de 66 años de edad y su padre de 70 años de edad, una hermana de 35 años de edad, todos dependen de su negocio. Ella, posee una venta de ropa, dicha actividad la realiza para obtener ingresos y brindarle ayuda a su familia, lo desempeña desde hace 7 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar mercadería para su negocio, tales como: blusas, camisas, pantalones, faldas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a tener mejor el negocio y adquirir más mercadería.
Su sueño es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y tener un negocio más rentable.
texts.en:
Dinora lives with her family. Her mother is 66 years old, her father is 70 years old and her sister is 35 years old. They all depend on her business. She has a business selling clothing. This business allows her to earn an income and support her family. She has had her business for seven years. 
The loan she is requesting will allow her to purchase merchandise for her business like blouses, shirt, pants, skirts and other items. This investment will help her to improve her business and acquire more merchandise. 
Her dream is to offer a better quality of life to her family and to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: purchase blouses, shirts, pants, skirts and other items.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Abibatu from the Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is single with one five-year-old child.  After the death of her mother she decided to start her business, Abibatu established her soap business at her house. She began her business because she was trained with business and she needed to generate income to support her younger sisters and brother. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of capital to run her business.

Abibatu requires a loan in order to buy soap powder and palm oil to expand her shop business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, Abibatu plans to expand business more than even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soap powder and palm oil to expand her shop business.

loans.name: Maria Martina

texts.es:
María, vive con su familia, su esposo de 50 años de edad y sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 15 y 25 años de edad, todos trabajan para salir adelante. Ella, posee una tienda y dicha actividad la desempeña todos los días para tener mejores ganancias y lo realiza desde hace un año.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar productos de la canasta básica para el hogar, tales como: arroz, frijol, sal,  azúcar, golosinas, pan, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su negocio y satisfacción de los clientes.
Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen el bachillerato y continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
María lives with her family: her husband of 50 years and her two children ages 15 and 25. The whole family works hard to get ahead. María runs a small store, where she works every day. She started this store a year ago in order to earn more money. 

The loan María needs will allow her to buy basic groceries such as rice, beans, salt, sugar, candy, bread and other items. This investment will help her to increase her business and customer satisfaction. María's dream is that her children finish their high school education and continue their studies.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, salt, sugar, candy, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tool box

loans.name: Rotha

texts.en:
Rotha is 30 years old and a married mother of three children. The rest of her family is residing in Sa Ang district of Kandal province. Her rice cropping on one hectare and a half is her sole source of her income. She has been involved in her current business for several years.

Rotha is a first-cycle borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her farmland. Moreover, she will spend some portion of her loan to pump water for her crops. She hopes that she can make more income to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 100 metres of cloth material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, pesticides, insecticides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anabelio

texts.es:
Anabelio, está casado, tiene la edad de  53 años y vive con su hijo y  su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su plantación de maíz. El tienen un terreno ya sembrado en producción que necesita mejorar para mejorar sus condiciones de producción, el va aplicar abonos, y fumigaciones que sean necesarias. El tienen pensado salir adelante con su plantación y generar más cosecha para este próximo año y a su vez aumentar sus ingresos para un mejora bienestar familiar. 
 Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Anabelio is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and his son, who are his biggest priority. With this loan, Anabelio hopes to buy some supplies for his corn plantation. He has a plot of land that he has already sown but needs some help to produce his crops. He will apply necessary fertilizers and fumigations. 

Anabelio's plan is to move forward with his plantation and increase his production for the coming year. This will improve his earnings to help provide for his family. This is his second loan with FUDECOSUR. Anabelio has never received a loan from national banks, though FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies to improve his crops.

loans.name: 33- Los Amigos Mas 1 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 33- LOS AMIGOS MAS 1,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes cinco mujeres y tres varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Zulema tiene un hijo pequeño, ella se dedica  a la venta de   artículos de temporada a crédito, según lo que crea conveniente vender y a veces por pedido que ella visita distintos mercados de la zona ofreciendo sus productos,   Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Zulema va a usar este préstamo para la compra de Mercadería como edredones y frazadas para surtir la variedad de sus productos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es porque la cliente no cuenta con reservas de dinero para estas fechas, la Sra. Zulema enfrenta retos en su negocio que son La época de frío es demasiado fuerte por esta zona donde vive y ella tiene que ir ofreciendo su mercadería y esto le perjudica un poco, pero igual sigue saliendo a tempranas horas de la mañana y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar edredones, frazadas y artículos que sean abrigadores por la época en la  que nos encontramos.
texts.en: The communal bank 33- LOS AMIGOS MAS 1 is made up of eight members, five women and three men. The president of the bank is Zulema, who has a young child. She sells seasonal orders on credit, according to what she believes will sell and at times by customer order as she visits various markets in the area offering her products. This loan is her first of a sequence within the institution. Zulema is going to use the loan to buy merchandise such as comforters and blankets to stock a variety of products. Her reason for asking for a loan is because she doesn't have the savings right now. Zulema has challenges in her business as the cold season is rather strong in the area where she lives and she has to go offer the merchandise and this is a slight disadvantage, but nonetheless she leaves during the early  morning hours and is going to use the funds to buy comforters, blankets, and articles that will provide warmth for the season in which we find ourselves.

loans.use: to buy bed comforters at wholesale.

loans.name: Cristino Aparicio

texts.es:
Cristino, se le presenta la necesidad de un nuevo  préstamo porque requiere de mas capitla de trabajo; este le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la producción y aumentara el cultivo, asimismo las ventas.
Las circunstancias familiares y las condiciones economicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Cristino is in need of a new loan because he needs more capital for work. This will allow him to buy the necessary agricultural supplies like manure, pest-control substances, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, among others. This investment will help him improve his production and grow his yield, and in turn, his sales. 

The circumstances of his family and his economic conditions have already improved.

loans.use: to buy manure, pest-control substances, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, among others.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is in her late twenties and married with three children between the ages of four and ten years-old. She runs a general merchandise store in the Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since 2003 and she sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits within her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is a lack of capital to expand her business.

Isatu requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits to resell.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid, who is a proud American citizen now, moved to the Bay Area almost 20 years ago from Yemen. “My biggest dream is to be a successful father to my four children,” Khalid says.

A well-respected taxi driver by clients and fellow drivers alike, Khalid got his start driving taxis and limos 15 years ago after he spotted a beautiful Lincoln Town Car on the street. He wanted to drive the car so badly that he spent two weeks driving nonstop all over the Bay Area to learn every possible limo route, and he’s been driving ever since. Being employed under a cab company has its disadvantages, however, as most of Khalid’s profits are eaten up by the large daily fee his company charges him to drive under their name. Because of this, Khalid is an extremely low income individual and he seeks more financial stability for his children and himself.

By establishing his own taxi business, "Belvedere Tiburon Taxi", Khalid will take advantage of his well-established customer base and increase his profits. He will specialize in rides to the airport, while also providing regular taxi services to residents in Belvedere and Tiburon. He hopes that the business will grow to include other drivers, and that he can increase his income enough to buy a house and send his children to college.

This loan will allow Khalid to purchase a taxi license to establish the enterprise, commercial auto insurance, and car painting with his new logo, as well as provide him with working capital to start his business.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi license to help support his family of six.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a truck driver with four years of experience in the trucking industry. He recently purchased a truck from his current employer to begin his trucking business, hauling construction materials from distributors to construction sites.

After finding ACCION Texas Inc. online, Abel applied and was later approved for a $5,450 loan. The loan allowed him to provide another form of income for his family who depend on his business too. The loan also helped Abel pay for business registration. He registered his business as "MAGA Trucking" and will operate it as a second job hauling gravel, dirt, sand and other base materials for construction purposes.

loans.use: to purchase a truck and begin his business providing another source of income for his family

loans.name: Titik

texts.en:
Titik will come in as a Nusantara Maritime Academy student, taking management programs in Commerce and Harbor Administration. Titik wants to become an expert in the field of shipping and administration to work in the port. She's a first child with two brothers, but her brother has died. Titik has long had separated parents. Her mother is just a regular worker, and her father left them and her mother. Titik is currently living with her uncle, because her mother was no longer able to support her. Titik wants to continue her education so that, after finishing college, she can help her mother and uncle. Titik's expectation is to obtain a loan from Kiva investors so she can finish her education smoothly and can lighten the burden on her uncle. She wants to quickly get to work.

Titik is very grateful to Kiva investors who will help finance her study.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Sdey

texts.en: Sdey is in her mid-20s, the mother of an infant and resides in Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province, Sdey is a paid worker with a decent job at the factory. She has held her job for one year and she manages to earn about 25,000 KHR per day. This is Sdey's second microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan already. Nowadays, the transportation cost for commuting back and forth to her workplace is quite a challenge for her. She is requesting another loan to buy a decent motorbike to overcome her transportation issue. She hopes that this purchase will help her a lot.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to overcome he transportation challenges

loans.name: Ngao's Group

texts.en: Ngao, a young mother of one child, is a resident from Sa Ang district of Kandal province. To overcome the family’s hardship, she grows rice and her husband sells ice cream as their main sources of income. She has had her business for seven years and earns about 26,400 KHR per day. This is Ngao's second microloan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and she hopes to build her own house to live in. She formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. As leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, insecticide, and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes to make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy potash, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Roeun, 60, has six children and is a villager from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province where rice farming is a popular business. She earns a living farming rice while her husband works for others for a fee during his spare time away from the rice paddy. Roeun has engaged in her current business for 16 years. She is able to earn about 39,600 KHR per day. Roeun has never taken out a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is applying for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and insecticide. She hopes to minimize loss due to insects and boost her crops with a good yield so that she can save more income for when she is older.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, está casado, tiene la edad de 51 años, actualmente vive con su hijo y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar los insumos para mejorar su plantación de café, ella va comprar abonos, plaguicidas y todo tipo de fumigaciones necesarias. Ella tiene como meta mejorar la calidad  de su plantación y así poder obtener más producción para este siguiente año. Ella espera que pueda generar más ganancias para el bienestar de familia y tener una economía más estable.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Marlene is married and is 51 years old. She currently lives with her son and her husband, who are her biggest priorities. She plans to use the loan to purchase supplies to improve her coffee production, purchasing fertilizers, insecticides and all kinds of necessary fumigation products. Her goal is to improve the quality of her coffee plantation and thus be able to have more production in the coming years. She hopes she can earn more income for her family's well-being and to have more financial stability. This is her first loan with Kiva partner FUDECOSUR. She has not had any previous loans with other state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to improve her coffee production.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary is a young mother of one little child, living in the Bovel district of Battambang province. She and the rest of her family rely solely upon a rice farming business. She has been engaged in this work for five years, and it has returned her a decent income.

Nary is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking her first loan, which she will use to pay a plowing fee, labor cost, and to buy rice seed and potash fertilizer. She hopes to plant her rice paddy timely and earn more income next harvest, for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee, labor cost, and to buy rice seed and potash fertilizer

loans.name: Amelia Estela

texts.es:
Amelia, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su actividad; este le permitirá comprar materia prima necesaria, tales como: tomates, cebollas, chiles, pescado, pollo, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar su negocio y las ventas, asimismo incrementaron los clientes; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Amelia has found the need to request another loan because she requires more working capital to continue investing in her business. This will allow her to purchase necessary ingredients, such as tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, fish, chicken and other items. The previous loan was a big help to her business and her sales, as her customers increased and her economic and household conditions improved.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, fish, chicken and other items.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a 50-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. The youngest is 15 years old. Dioscora engages in fishing. She catches fish, crabs and sea shells to earn a living. She has been fishing for more than 10 years.

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fishing materials, like a fishing net and marine paint for the boat. The materials will be very helpful in gaining a bigger catch and augmenting her income. Dioscora hopes that she might provide her children with good food and quality education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, like a fishing net and marine paint for the boat

loans.name: Edgardo Antonio

texts.es:
Edgardo, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de mas capital de trabajo para aumentar la clientela y mejorar el negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar café, maíz, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas e incrementar las ganancias; la situación económica ha mejorado y las circunstancias familiares asimismo.
texts.en: Edgardo has found the need to request another loan because her requires more working capital to grow his customer base and improve his business. This investment will help him purchase coffee, corn, rice, beans, sugar and other items. The previous loan helped him increase his sales and his profits. His economic situation has improved, as have his family's circumstances.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, corn, rice, beans, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Ktaob

texts.en: Ktaob is 26 years old and a married mother of two children, one in school. Ktaob is a rice grower from Moung Russey district. She is able to earn about 22,000 KHR per from the business that she has had for six years. Ktaob is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) who has repaid her past loans, using them successfully to improve her lifestyle. For this loan, she is seeking 3,000,000 KHR to buy potash for her farmland and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes that she can gain a higher yield than before.

loans.use: To buy potash for her farmland and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sarin, age 59, is a parent of one child who is helping the family business, nowadays. Corn and rice cultivation are the main sources of income for Sarin's family. This is the business that she has managed for 20 years.

Now Sarin, a seventh-time borrower, forms a group of two, to seek a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past six loans enabled her to support her business and her living standard, at a good pace. This time, Sarin is seeking to borrow 500,000 KHR, whereas the other group member is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, Sarin will spend her loan portion to buy insecticide for her corn. She hopes to reap a good yield from her agribusiness.

loans.use: To buy insecticide for her corn

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en: Agripina is a 47-year-old married woman with four children from Talibon,Bohol. The oldest child is 22 while the youngest is 14. She is engaged in a food vending business. She makes kalamay, a sticky sweet delicacy made of glutinous rice, grated coconut,and brown sugar. She has been making and vending kalamay for more than 10 years. Her husband works as a porter. Agripina requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy more supplies like glutinous rice and brown sugar along with clothing for her children. Agripina would like to expand her business to support her children's education and provide good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like glutinous rice and brown sugar and clothing for her children

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb, one of the breadwinners [for a family] including one little kid, is a citizen from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She manages three hectares of rice farming as her main source of income. Her husband supplements the family income by working for others for a fee.

Chreb is in her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. After a successful loan that she fully paid back, she has managed to support her business. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking a loan of 1,000,000 riels each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seven sacks of potash to boost her crop production. She highly believes that she can gain double yield from her crop.

loans.use: To buy seven sacks of potash to boost her crop production

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María,  vive con su familia, su madre, sus hermanos y sus dos hijos,  los cuales tienen  edades de 12 y 13 años, en donde dependen de ella, ya que es madre soltera, no posee familiares en el extranjero. Ella, posee una tienda de productos varios y asimismo se dedica a la venta de antojitos, tales como: pasteles, enchiladas, papitas fritas, entre otros, poco a poco ha ido creciendo en su actividad, una de las ventajas que posee es que tiene conocimiento sobre el mercado que maneja.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar productos básicos, tales como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal, y también una freidora metálica; esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar la producción y asimismo a surtir la tienda.
Su sueño es generar mayores ingresos para así ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: María lives with her mother, her brothers and her two children, ages 12 and 13. They depend on her because she is a single mother, and she doesn't have relatives abroad. María has a general store and also makes a living selling snacks like cakes, enchiladas, french fries and other items. Little by little her business has grown. One of the advantages she has is that she has knowledge about her market. She is requesting the loan to purchase basic goods, such as beans, rice, sugar and salt, as well as a deep-fryer. This investment will help her increase her production and stock her store. Her dream is to earn a higher income and thus offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, sugar, salt and also a deep-fryer.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, sus padres de 50 años de edad y 55 años de edad, todos trabajan en el negocio. El es tipógrafo y asimismo se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir y lo hace con las escuelas y demás personas para obtener ingresos, lo realiza desde hace 15 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar la materia prima tales como: tela, agujas, hilo, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio.
Su sueño es construir su propia casa y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: José lives with his parents, ages 50 and 55, and all of them work in the business. He is a tailor and makes a living sewing clothes for schools and others to earn income, which he has done for 15 years. He is requesting the loan to purchase supplies such as fabric, needles, thread and other items. This investment will help strengthen the business. His dream is to build his own home and to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, needles, thread and other items.

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Ángel, es una persona que vive sola, tiene hijos pero ya están casados, no posee familiares en el extranjero. Ella, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad para el hogar, dicha actividad la realiza de 6:00am a 8:30pm, lo realiza desde hace 8 años y oficio que lo aprendió de su familia, la ventaja que posee es que tiene conocimiento sobre lo que desempeña.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar productos de la canasta básica, tales como: azúcar, frijoles, arroz,  sal, golosinas, sodas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a crecer más en su negocio.
Su sueño es terminar de cancelar su casa, crear un buen record crediticio  y dejarle herencia a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ángel lives alone and has children who are now married. She does not have any family abroad. She makes her living selling basic necessities for the home, which she does from 6:00am to 8:30pm. She has been doing this for 8 years, something she learned from her family. Her advantage is that she really knows how to carry out this work.

The loan she is seeking will allow her to buy basic products: sugar, beans, rice, salt, candies, sodas, among others. This investment will help her grow her business more.

Her dream is to finish paying off her house, establish a good credit record, and leave an inheritance for her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bean, rice, salt, candies, sodas, among others.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
A parent in her late 20s, and a citizen from Moung Russey District, Battambang Province, Chanthy is the mother of three children: two schoolchildren and one little kid. For her kids’ sake, she deals with the daily cost of living by rice farming on one hectare and sells grocery items for extra income. She has been involved in her current business for 10 years, and she is able to earn up to 34,000 riels (KHR) per day.

Chanthy, a five-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has fully repaid back her past loans wisely. They have improved her lifestyle, which is now better than before. She is the leader of a group consisting of two female members. Chanthy will spend her loan portion to buy potash and insecticide, and to pay for the cost of labor. Moreover, she will spend a portion of it to buy more grocery items for resale. She highly believes that she can gain a high yield from her crops and absorb more clients in her grocery selling business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Athanasius

texts.en:
Athanasius comes from the small islands in eastern Indonesia; precisely, the village Letvuan, in the islands of Kei Kecil, in the region of Southeast Maluku. He left his parents and two brothers to study management for Commerce and Harbour Administration in the Nusantara Maritime Academy (AMN), on the island of Java, in the city of Cilacap. Currently, he has been accepted as a prospective student in AMN.

Both parents work as farmers and they have irregular income, because it is influenced by weather and the growing seasons. To comply with the expectations of his parents, and, in order to learn diligently and quickly complete his college education, Athanasius will work hard. All efforts are being made to help his parents, since his parents are just farmers. Athanasius is very saddened by the condition of his parents. He is determined to quickly complete his studies. He hopes, with a loan from investors from Kiva, he can help overcome their difficulties. Athanasius hopes to quickly get a job in a shipping company.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, vive con su nuera, dos nietos y también un hijo. Ella, posee una tienda. Ella, posee una tienda  para obtener ingresos y aportar a su familia  y lo desempeña desde hace 6 años con los horarios de 6:00am a 6:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar más mercadería para surtir el negocio, tales como: arroz, frijoles, azucar, sal, papel higienico, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara para adquirir más  productos y gastos para el hogar.
Su sueño es crecer la tienda y trabajar mas fuerte.
texts.en: Teresa lives with her daughter-in-law, two grandchildren and also her son. She runs a general store to earn an income and support her family, which she has done for the past six years working from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. She is requesting the loan to purchase more merchandise to stock her business with products like rice, beans, sugar, salt, toilet paper and other items. This investment will help her acquire more products and pay the bills. Her dream is to grow her business and work very hard.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, salt, toilet paper and other items.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere invertir en el negocio, asimismo hacer reparaciones en el lugar donde radica el puesto de trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar leche para la elaboración de cuajada, utensilios para el negocio, artículos necesarios para la venta y producción de tamales.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares igualmente, ayudo a la satisfacción de los clientes.
texts.en: Apolinaria has found the need to request another loan because she wants to invest in her business and make repairs to her sales post. This investment will help her purchase milk to make curds as well as utensils and supplies to make and sell tamales. The previous loan had a favorable effect, since her economic conditions have improved, as have her family circumstances, and it helped her satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase milk to make curds as well as utensils and supplies to make and sell tamales.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 40-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. Her whole family is busy in the same business, which is making noodles and selling them in the market. The duties and liabilities for making noodles are assigned to each family member. Bushra makes the dough, her daughter passes the dough through a pasta machine, her one son is responsible for packing, and her husband sells these noodles in the market.

Due to the current market in Pakistan, the price of flour is higher than earlier and, due to excess demand for noodles, Bushra wants to make more noodles to fulfill the demand. Therefore, she requested a loan of 45,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, she will buy all the ingredients, such as flour, eggs and oil, which are necessary for making noodles, so that she can fulfill the demand of the customers.

Bushra is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy to buy flour, eggs and oil for making noodles to sell.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor tiene 60 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo, ya que sus 5 hijos son independientes. 
Flor se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles desde una tienda instalada en su hogar. Lleva funcionando hace más de 05 años, tiempo con el cual logró una regular clientela, contando con la ayuda de sus hijos en la atención al público.
Le gusta su actividad  por que le gusta el ingreso económico que le genera, con el cual poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. 
Por tanto, tiene planes de  hacer incrementar el stock de sus productos y diversificar su variedad para así tener más acogida entre sus clientes.
Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva, se siente contenta con la oportunidad brindada de poder contar con un capital de trabajo, desea poder seguir contando con éste apoyo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus  pagos. Con el monto  de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará  más variedad de productos como conservas, aceites, arroz, etc.
texts.en:
Flor is 60 years old. She is married and lives in her own house together with her husband as their 5 children are independent. Flor works selling food products from a store located in her home. She has been in this business for more than 5 years. During this time she has gathered a regular customer base, relying on the help of her children for waiting on customers. 

She likes this business because she likes the income that it generates for her, which she uses to support her husband with the housekeeping costs. So she plans to increase her product stock and widen her variety in order to be more attractive to her customers.

This will be her first loan with Kiva. She is happy for the opportunity that has been provided to be able to have working capital. She wants to be able to continue counting on this support, and she gives her word to be punctual in her payments. With the amount of 1000 new sols, she will buy a wider variety of products, like canned goods, oil, rice, etc.

loans.use: to buy canned food, oil, rice, etc. for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 45-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. A mother of a 9-year-old son, she does farming. She toils on the land and grows rice. Her husband is also a farmer.

Due to lack of financial capacity to continue her farming business, Lydia requested a loan of 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizers, pay for laborer and pay for school fees. In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her farming business to continue to send her child to school as well as provide good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pay for labor and pay for school fees.

loans.name: Sarem's Group

texts.en:
Sarem is 51 years old and a rice farmer on a 2.5-hectare area in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has five children. She has been involved in the current business for ages, and she is able to earn up to 27,800 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is not the original loan for Sarem with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success, and she managed to sustain her business and her lifestyle better than before. 

Now, she forms a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gain double yield, better than before, and gain a high income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en:
Rat is 63 years old and married. She and her family are living in Kampong Cham province where she does her agribusiness, rice farming. She endures her family’s hardship via a rice cropping business. Involved in the current business for 30 years, she is able to earn up to 25,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Rat is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s parter). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely, which has supported her livelihood in good shape, better than before. For this new loan, she will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees and transplanting fees. She hopes that she can gain high yield from her current business to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee and transplanting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is a 24-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children, ages 5, 4 and 2. She engages in a fish-vending business. She sells various fresh fish to the people in the community. Due to the demand of her customers, Marites requested a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more various fresh fish to attract more customers and augment her income. In the future, Marites would like expand her livelihood activity as well as to set aside some of the profits, and provide her family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more various fresh fish.

loans.name: Sokyeng

texts.en:
A young mother residing in Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province, Sokyeng is 26 years old and married. Her main sources of income are from a rice cropping business that she has managed and the salary from her husband’s job as a construction worker at Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has been involved in this job for five years, earning about 23,400 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

Sokyeng is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now seeking a new loan to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow rainy season crops. She hopes this purchase will help her to timely plant her crops and make a good income.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow rainy season crops.

loans.name: Iwan

texts.en:
Iwan is a prospective student of Nusantara Maritime Academy (AMN). He is 18 years old, and he lives alone and away from his parents. Iwan's parents live in a remote village in rural Benjuring, Dobo, Aru Islands, eastern Indonesia. His father works as a farmer whose income is not fixed. The income of farmers relies heavily on weather conditions and seasons. His parents want one of their children to attend school. That is a happy future for Iwan; Iwan's brother works as a fisherman. Thanks to his parents' encouragement, Iwan is determined to learn in the program of Management and Harbour Administration in Commerce at AMN. The ideal for Iwan is to work in a large port in Indonesia. 

Due to economic conditions (his parents have no fixed income), Iwan volunteered to request a student loan from Kiva in order to ease the burden on his parents and continue his studies. Iwan is very grateful to the lenders from around the world who will help him with his studies, even though he is not able to get to know them personally.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en:
Yeng is 50 years old and a villager from Kampong Cham province’s Thbaung Khmum district. She has three independent children, some of whom are helping in the business, and some run a small business to earn a living. To strive for a living, she grows paddy rice on a half-hectare area as the primary income source. She has engaged in the current business since she was 20 years old. Now, she can earn up to 22,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

Yeng, who has a past loan history with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has repaid her loan wisely, and she has managed to support her business promptly and earn a decent enough income to buy a hand-tractor for her paddy rice faming business. For this loan cycle, she forms a group of three to apply for a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay transplanting fees and to buy fertilizer for her crops. She expects to grow her crops on time and make a good yield.

loans.use: To pay transplanting fees and to buy fertilizer for her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Fe y Esperanza está conformado, por 12 integrantes madres soleteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidades. Ellas son originarias de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país.  Ellas se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Que ha  luchado en la vida por salir adelante y tener un futuro mejor para sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad.
La coordinadora del banco comunal Fe y Esperanza es Cándida Rosa y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, detergentes, aceite,  jabón, detergente, fósforos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto en su casa de habitación, ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Fe y Esperanza agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The Fe y Esperanza (Faith and Hope) communal bank is made up of 12 members, all of whom are single mothers with 20 children under their care. They are natives of Malpaisillo, a place located in the northern region of the country. The members are described as hardworking, responsible and ambitious women who have fought to get ahead in life so their children can have a better future. Sadly, none of them were able to go to school because of a lack of resources, and they had to work from an early age. The coordinator for the community bank is Cándida Rosa, who makes a living running a convenience store out of her home, selling small quantities of products such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, eggs, detergents, oil, soap and matches. She takes a lot of pleasure out of her work, and she dedicates 12 hours a day to the business. She plans to use the loan to increase her working capital and stock her store with products so that in the not-too-distant future she can earn more income. The community bank is grateful for the help that Kiva's lenders provide to people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a better life.

loans.use: to have working capital and stock her store with products like rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, detergents, oil, soap and matches.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is a mother of two schoolchildren who lives in the Srey Snom district of the Siem Reap province. She is 29 years old and her main source of income comes from rice cultivation, which she has been involved in for several years. 

This is not the first micro-loan for Sophorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her loan and has utilized it wisely to improve her standard of living so it is better than before. 

For this cycle, Sophorn is seeking a new loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a high yield to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: El Batallon De Jehova Group

texts.en:
Fiordaliza is a member of the El Batallon de Jehova (Jesus Christ’s Troops) Group located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris where businesses as diverse as industrial cement plants and household and cosmetic products companies exist. This group comprises 20 members who sell different products all over their rural community as well as some others nearby.

Fiordaliza sells cosmetics and other miscellaneous products. She is a single woman with two children who has run her business for the past two years. This will be her second loan with Esperanza International. She successfully repaid her previous loan.

El Batallon de Jehova is applying for a 197,000 DOP loan from Esperanza International. Fiordaliza will use her portion of this loan to buy different products such as cosmetics, underwear, shoes, etc. Her dream is to increase her sales and grow her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin, a resident from the Sa Ang district, is 56 years old. She depends solely on her grocery-selling business and Khmer noodle-selling business.  This business has returned about 28,900 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Chin with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely and it has supported her grocery store business. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan to replenish her grocery items business for resale in the hope of earning a higher income. She hopes to increase her income so she can enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is a 51-years-old married man with 6 school-aged children. He hails from Talibon, Bohol. He engages in seaweed farming. He grows cultured seaweed as a means of his livelihood. He has been doing seaweed farming for almost 5 years now.

To be able to meet the high demand for seaweed, Nilo requested a loan of 4000 PHP to buy rope, nylon, additional seaweed seedlings and to pay for school fees. In the future, Nilo would like to expand his seaweed farming to continue to pay for his children's education and also provide his family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rope, nylon, additional seaweed seedlings and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Reyson

texts.en:
Reyson is a 22-years-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He is the father of a seven-month-old baby boy. 

He engages in a food vending business. He sells fried chicken and pork to the people in the community. 

To be able to gain more income, Reyson requested a loan of 8000 PHP to buy more supplies such as chicken, pork, seasonings and spices, in order to produce more and to attract customers. In the future, Reyson would like to increase his own capital by expanding his food vending business to provide his family with the best.

loans.use: to buy more supplies such as chicken, pork, seasonings and spices.

loans.name: Christian Colony Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 37-years-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, to buy a tractor trolley for her husband. Her husband provides services for the loading and unloading of construction material, such as sand and soil, to builders. A few days ago the tractor trolley broke due to a serious collapse with the truck and cannot be repaired.

Samina wants her husband to carry on this business because this is the only source of income for her family. She has some savings but it is insufficient to buy a new trolley so she requested a loan.

Samina is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: Samina raises her hand in the given picture.

loans.use: to buy a tractor trolley for loading and unloading services.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 43-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol.  She has eight children; the oldest child is 24, while the youngest is 3. 

She is engaged in the fishing business. She catches fish, crab, and sea shells.  Angelita earns 3,000 PHP a month with this fishing business, and she has been fishing for almost 10 years.

Angelita requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fuel (for the motor boat), a fishing net, and food for the family. 

In the future, Angelita hopes that she could send her children to school and have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fuel (for the motor boat), a fishing net, and food for the family

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 50-year-old married woman with four grown children. She hails from Talibon, Bohol. 

Antonia engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish, crab, and sea shells as her main source of livelihood. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy paint, epoxy (adhesive), nails, and a laborer's fee (for boat repair). 

In the future, Antonia would like to expand her fishing activity so she can set aside some of the profits to purchase a larger pump boat, which is very helpful in her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy paint, epoxy (adhesive), nails, and a laborer's fee (for boat repair)

loans.name: Jenny Rose

texts.en:
Jenny Rose is a 22-year-old married woman with a two year old child.  She is from Getafe, Bohol. 

Jenny Rose runs a RTW (ready to wear) business.  She sells items like t-shirts, pants, blouses, mini-skirts and dresses. She has been selling RTW for almost two years. 

To attract more customers, Jenny Rose requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy various shirts, blouses, pants, and shorts. 

In the future, Jenny Rose would like to expand her RTW business to become a successful businesswoman, and at the same time, provide her child with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy various shirts, blouses, pants and shorts.

loans.name: Ana Deisy

texts.es:
Ana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar con su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar sandalias, ropa interior, camisas, blusas, entre otros para ofrecerles a los clientes.
El crédito anterior fue positivo, ya que las condiciones económicas han mejorado por lo que las ventas han incrementado y hay ingresos mejores en la familia.
texts.en:
Ana needs to take out another loan because she needs more working capital to continue with her business. This investment will help her to buy sandals, underwear, shirts, blouses, and more to offer the customers. 

The previous loan was positive, since economic conditions have improved and sales have increased and the family's income is better.

loans.use: to buy sandals, underwear, shirts, blouses and more.

loans.name: Church St# 4 Group

texts.en:
Kausar  is a  47-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her husband and six children. 

She wants to take a loan for her elder son; since 2001, he has been learning the work of sewing seat covers for cars.  Now he has become expert and has chosen it for his profession. He wants to start his own business of sewing seat covers for cars.  He wants to buy a sewing machine, rexene (fabric coated with plastic), thread, and the initial tools, but he has a problem due to low capital and feels compelled to take a loan.

Kausar is a responsible mother; she wants to fulfill the needs of her son at any cost.  This is why she requested a loan of Rs.40,000 from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.  Her son could buy a sewing machine, rexene, and thread for his own business. 

Her desire is that this business gets ahead by day & nights. 

Note: Kausar has her hand raised in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rexine (fabric coated with plastic), a sewing machine, and thread for sewing seat covers for cars and motorbikes.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 50 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to re-stock her store with food and household goods like milk, coffee, cream, soap, shampoo, etc to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with food and household goods like milk, coffee, cream, soap, shampoo, etc to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 39 años de edad de estado civil Divorsiada tiene dos hijos vive  con los hijos en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. 

Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos y una bomba para fumigar, además balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir sembrando y aumentar la produccion le gusta hacere deporte los domingod.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and divorced. She has two children and lives with them in the community of Mina de Piedra, which is in the Ventanas canton,  province of Los Ríos. 

She belongs to the 30 DE NOVIEMBRE communal bank, which is located in MINA DE PIEDRA, Ventanas canton, and dedicated to farming and livestock work.  

Elizabeth works in agriculture. She plants corn and raises penned animals such as pigs and chickens. With the loan, she will be able to buy materials such as: fertilizers, manure, and a fumigation pump, as well as balanced feed. She does her buying in the city of Ventanas. 

Her dream is to buy some land to keep planting and increasing production. She likes to play sports on Sundays.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and a fumigation pump, as well as balanced feed.

loans.name: Galo Andres

texts.es:
Galo tiene 48 años de edad de estado civil Union Libre tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Galo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para construir una casa le gusta hacer deporte y caminar por el campo.
texts.en:
Galo is 48  years old. He is in a common law marriage and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in the community of Mina de Piedra in the  Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos. 

He belongs to the 30 DE NOVIEMBRE communal bank, located in MINA DE PIEDRA, Ventanas canton, dedicated to agricultural and livestock work. 

Galo works in agriculture, growing corn and penned animals such as chickens and pigs. With the loan, he will buy materials such as fertilizer, insecticide to avoid pests and disease, as well as balanced feed for the animals. He makes his purchases in the city of Ventanas. 

His dream is to buy some land to build a house. He likes to play sports and walk through the countryside.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide to avoid pests and disease, as well as balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Caren Herlinda

texts.es:
Caren tiene 22 años de edad de estado civil Soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Caren se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de cerdos. 

Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades y alimento para los cerdos. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar un carro y terminar los estudios le gusta mucho festejar las fiestas del carnaval y bailar toda clase de musica.
texts.en:
Caren is 22 and single. She doesn't have children and lives with her parents in the community of Mina de Piedra, in the Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos. 

She belongs to the 30 DE NOVIEMBRE communal bank. It is located in MINA DE PIEDRA, Ventanas canton, dedicated to agricultural and livestock work.   

Caren works in agriculture, planting corn and raising pigs. With the loan, she will be able to buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide to avoid pests and feed for the pigs.  She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas. 

Her dream is to buy a car and finish her studies. She really likes to celebrate carnival and dance to all kinds of music.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide to avoid pests and disease and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Amparo Yamileth

texts.es:
La  señora Amparo  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo y sus 4  hijos  en  un caserío al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta    de golosinas.  
Doña Amparo tiene más de 16 de tener su negocio de venta de comidas, necesita el préstamo  para la compra  de carnes, maíz, manteca, azúcar, colorantes, condimentos, plátanos, lechugas, tomates, repollo, etc.
Doña Amparo  con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer  a sus clientes y así poder atenderlos mejor, también espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. 
Doña Amparo en unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de los más grandes y reconocidos de la zona y también  espera que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras  –  Junio   del   2013
texts.en:
Amparo is a responsible, hardworking and honest person. She lives with her husband and their 4 children in a community in southern Honduras. her business is selling snacks.
  
Amparo has had her business selling food for more than 16 years. She needs the loan to buy meat, corn, lard, coloring, seasoning, plantains, lettuce, tomaotes, cabbage, etc. 

With the loan,  Amparo hopes for the sales in her business to rise by having more product to offer her customers and thus be able to serve them better. She also hopes to cover her needs and improve her and her family's quality of life a little better. 
 
Amparo hopes that in a few years her business will keep growing and become one of the biggest and best known in the area. She also hopes that her children will become good people with better opportunities in life. 

Choluteca, Honduras  –  June, 2013

loans.use: to buy meat, corn, lard, sugar, coloring, seasonings, plantains, lettuce, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Anabelle works hard to support her family. She has a bamboo furniture-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income working at a general store. Anabelle is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional bamboo and other materials for her furniture-making business. Anabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bamboo and other materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a 38-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 2 children aged 10 and 2 years. She engages in fishing. She catches fish and crab and sells it to the community. Aside from fishing, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items such as cooking oil, coffee, sugar, eggs and soft drinks. Marilyn has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy crab net, nylon and lift weights, which will help her to increase her catch. In the future, Marilyn would like to expand both of her businesses in order to provide her children with good living conditions and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy crab net, nylon and lift weights, which will help her to increase her catch.

loans.name: Rikson

texts.en:
Rikson had desired to go to school for long enough but, because of poor conditions, he had to postpone school for three years. Rikson is living in the islands; precisely, in the Aru islands in Benjuring village, east of Indonesia. Both of his parents are elderly and work as farmers whose income is erratic and covers the costs of daily living. During the delay, Rikson  worked to help his parents.

Currently Rikson is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN). He chose the Commerce program, Management and Harbour Administration, because, with his ability and ideals, he hopes to work in the office of the National Transportation Agency. Because he does not want to burden his parents, Rikson applied for a loan from Kiva for the cost of his studies. Rikson is very grateful to the lenders who will help him with his studies so, hopefully, this loan will help his family.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Asiscla

texts.en: Asiscla is 46 years old and widowed with four children. With four children currently in school, Asiscla works very hard to provide for them. Asiscla runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store. Asiscla has been in this business for 10 years. She sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cereals, laundry soap, canned goods, milk and other groceries. In the future, Asiscla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.en: Ana Vilma works hard to support her family. Ana Vilma is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ana Vilma requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. Ana Vilma has been in this business for 13 years now. In the future, Ana Vilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en: Rudy will enter the Nusantara Maritime Academy (AMN) this year. He will be a student who takes the Management program, Commercial Shipping and Port Administration. Rudy comes from a village in Dobo, Aru Islands, Maluku Tenggara Timur, eastern Indonesia. His parents work as simple farmers. Their very limited income is just enough to meet everyday needs. As a parent, his mother wishes for Rudy to get his education for the future and to help his brothers. Due to his mother's expectations, Rudy ventured to apply for a loan from Kiva to pay for his education until completion. He wants to get out of college and become a professional employee in a harbor. Rudy really hopes for the support of Kiva investors.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Poly

texts.en: Poly is a prospective student of the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He took the Nautical program in accordance with the department while in high school. He's the first child of four children. His father works as a merchant. The income received is very minimal, sometimes lacking for everyday needs. However, all parents want their children to get a good education for the sake of their future. As the first child, Poly is expected to complete his studies quickly. Due to family circumstances and the expectations of his parents, Poly is applying for a loan from Kiva to help him pay for his studies. Poly hopes to finish his studies and quickly get the job he aspires to as a reliable captain, in order to help his three sisters with financing to complete their schooling.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Ma. Leny

texts.en: Ma. Leny is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Leny is 43 years old and has four children who are in school. Ma. Leny has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Leny requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. Ma. Leny has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Ma. Leny would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Beatriz is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

Beatriz has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Beatriz requested a 18000 PHP loan through NWTF to increase her inventory of dry goods to sell.

Beatriz has been in this business for 8 years. Beatriz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Hedda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Hedda works hard to support her family. She has a vehicle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Hedda is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her vehicle. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Hedda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like rice, vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Josephine has been in this business for 14 years.

Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 43 года замужем имеет 1 ребенка. Бактыгул работает швеей в частном швейном цеху. В свободное время она не сидит сложав руки, а дополнительно занимается животноводством, начала разводить скот еще в 1999 году с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и невероятному терпению Бактыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова и 10 овец. Супруг-пенсионер, помогает по хозяйству. Ежемесячный доход от хозяйства составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а также в будущем мечтает купить автомашину своему сыну.
texts.en: Baktygul is 43 years old, she is married and has one child. Baktygul works as a seamstress in a private sewing factory. During her free time she is also busy and does animal husbandry, which she began in 1999 with an amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work and unbelievable patience Baktygul now has one cow and ten sheep in her livestock. Her husband is retired and helps her in the business. Her monthly income is 5,000 som. With the goal to further grow her business Baktygul has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy cows. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of livestock and also dreams to buy her son a car in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle and fodder for livestock.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, su madre de 49 años de edad y su esposa de 25 años de edad, todos trabajan juntos y todos los días para salir adelante. El, posee un molino, lo realiza desde hace varios años atrás, su esposa vende pan dulce y ropa americana.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar repuestos para el molino, un barril, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudará a crecer más en su actividad y brindarles un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Su sueño es progresar en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias, asimismo adquirir su propia casa.
texts.en:
José lives with his family, his 49-year-old mother and his 25-year-old wife. They all work together every day in order to prosper. 

He has owned a mill for several years now. His wife sells pastries and American-style clothes. 

He is requesting the loan to buy spare parts for his mill, including a barrel and other items. This investment will help his business to grow and will enable him to provide better service to his customers. 

His dream is for his business to develop and to increase his income as well as to buy his own home.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his mill, including a barrel and other items.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a 69-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has three grown children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like chips, biscuits, candies, condiments and cooking oil. Due to lack of capital to sustain her small store, Candelaria requested a loan of 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy assorted goods like biscuits, toiletries and beverages to attract more customers.

In the future, Candelaria hopes that she could manage her store well to be able to pay her weekly dues and to save in preparation of the old age.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods like biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa is a 44-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children; the oldest is 18 while the youngest is 5. She engages in tailoring services. She has been doing tailoring for almost five years. She accepts dressmaking and dress adjustments. She needs more capital to continue her tailoring services, so Celsa requested a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy cloth and various sewing materials like needles. In the the future, Celsa would like to improve her tailoring services to be able to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cloth and various sewing materials like needles.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru:
Чамила добрая и отзывчивая женщина в возрасте 43-х лет. После развода с мужем она одна воспитывала своих сыновей. Сейчас старшему сыну уже 27 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Младшему сыну 20 лет. Они все живут вместе в одном доме, расположенный в Яванском районе. 
Хотя Чамила по профессии медсестра, но в данный момент не работает по своей специальности. Чамила со своими сыновьями занимается животноводством. Они разводят крупно-рогатый скот для продажи. Вблизи их дома есть пастбище с хорошей травой, там они пасут своих коров и бычков. Чамила занимается данной деятельностью последние три года и за счет ее прибыли обеспечивает семью. Это единственный источник дохода их семьи. Сейчас Чамила обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота для откорма и продажи.
texts.en:
Jamila is a kind and outgoing woman age of 43. After divorcing her husband she has raised her sons alone. Right now her oldest son is 27 years old. He is married and has one child. Her youngest son is 20. They all live together in one house which is located in the region of Yavan.

Even though Jamila is a nurse by profession, she does not work in this field at this time. Jamila and her sons do animal husbandry. They breed large horned cattle for resale. Near their house there is a pasture with good grass where they graze their cows and calves. Jamila has been in this business for the past three years and feeds the family using this income. This is the only source of income for her family. Right now Jamila has come for a loan. She wants to increase the headcount of cattle for feeding and resale.

loans.use: to buy cows and calves to increase headcount of livestock.

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Crecencia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Crecencia is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more groceries and vegetables to sell.

Crecencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.en:
Crecencia is 50 years old and has seven children. Crecencia is married and has two children who are in school.

Crecencia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Crecencia requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Crecencia has been in pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Crecencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Diolita

texts.en:
Diolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle-transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Diolita has been in this business for 10 years. Diolita earns more income from a general store and firewood vending.

Diolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ma.colimor

texts.en:
Ma. Colimor is a 43-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol who has a 14-year-old daughter. She runs a store and sells various items ranging from biscuits, chocolates,  chips, noodles, sugar, soaps, and soft drinks. 

Ma. Colimor is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to buy rice, feed, canned goods, and soft drinks to fill her store. She hopes to save the profits from her loan to send her daughter to college and provide her with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, feed, canned goods, and soft drinks

loans.name: Eggi

texts.en:
Eggi is 19 years old. He is still very young and eager to advance in life. He lives in a small village; its name is Padangjaya, Majenang region, west of the city of Cilacap. He's the first child of three siblings. His sister is still attending school too. His father died years ago. His mother works as a maid in Jakarta. Eggi lives with his grandmother and his sisters.

Eggi's mother has a desire for all children to get an education so their future is better. Due to the condition of his mother, who has to finance  all her children's school expenses, Eggi is motivated to finish school quickly. Currently, he is a prospective student of the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, taking management programs Commerce and Harbor Administration. Eggi applied for a loan from Kiva in order to help ease the burden on his mother. Eggi also hopes he can quickly get a job as a clerk at a port or shipping company with the help of this loan.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 53 years old and married with three children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more stock like blouses, pants, bags, etc., to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the clothing business for six years and also earns additional income from food vending and direct selling of personal products.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock like blouses, pants, bags, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Gertrudes works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Gertrudes is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional items like pants, shoes, T-shirts, etc., to sell to her customers.

Gertrudes has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like pants, shoes, T-shirts, etc., to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mobile phones and accessories to resell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, 42, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lucia buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Lucia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.
