loans.name: Janette

texts.en: Janette is 48 years old, married, and has one child in school. Janette works very hard to provide for the family. Janette runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs and spices. Janette has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Janette would like to save enough money to expand her business and finish paying for her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store, including canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs and spices.

loans.name: Realyn

texts.en: Realyn is 51 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Realyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. Realyn has been raising pigs for four years, and she earns additional income from a general store and from buying and selling charcoal. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Gina has been in this business for three years. Gina earns more income from buying and selling vegetables.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell.

loans.name: Prosperidad

texts.en: Prosperidad is 64 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Prosperidad has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. Prosperidad applied for a PHP 49,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her business. Prosperidad has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Prosperidad would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her purified water business.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is a 42-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has five children; the oldest is 20 while the youngest is 12.

She engages in a food-vending business. She makes kalamay (a sticky, sweet delicacy made of coconut milk, brown sugar and ground glutinous rice). She works hard to earn a living. 

Due to the high demand for kalamay, Digna requested a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more ingredients like coconut milk, brown sugar, glutinous rice and empty coconut shells and canisters (for storage). 

In the future, Digna would like to manage her business well to grow and expand and to be able to send her children to school as well as have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like coconut milk, brown sugar, glutinous rice and empty coconut shells and canisters (for storage).

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional bags of rice to sell in her business. Rene has been in this business for 15 years. Rene earns additional income from a general store. Rene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna is 61 years old and married . She has six children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Paterna runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 38 years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, cooking oil, vinegar, coffee, canned goods, etc.  

Paterna requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soy sauce, cooking oil, vinegar, coffee, canned goods, etc., to sell in her general store.

In the future, Paterna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soy sauce, cooking oil, vinegar, coffee, canned goods, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Pedrita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall. 

In the future, Pedrita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
Placida is 51 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Placida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Placida has been raising livestock for four years, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc. for her tailoring business.

Raymunda has been in this business for 21 years; she earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her tailoring business.

Raymunda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc. for her business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell for her fruit vending business.

Vicenta has been in this business for 12 years. Vicenta earns more income from a general store.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Néstor Obed

texts.es: Néstor a sus 35 años de edad es separado y padre de 2 hijos. Su experiencia laboral comenzó cuando trabajaba como almacenista en diversas empresas, pero por cuestiones de la vida le salió la oportunidad de viajar a Estados Unidos, donde laboró como chef de comidas internacionales durante 7 años; finalmente retornó a Colombia donde inició su propio negocio con el dinero que ahorró durante los años de trabajo. En su negocio, Néstor ofrece variedad de comidas rápidas y ya cuenta con el apoyo de 2 empleadas, ya que su negocio se encuentra muy bien ubicado en una zona muy comercial. El titular es un hombre trabajador, activo y apasionado por sus hijos y su profesión, esto lo motivó a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en mejoras locativas (arreglo del piso del negocio), hacer volantes de publicidad y comprar insumos (carnes frías, panes, salsas, gaseosas) todo esto con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos, pues le dará una nueva imagen al negocio donde sus clientes se sentirán más cómodos y además tendrá insumos disponibles para satisfacer los gustos de sus comensales. Esto le permitirá avanzar y sacar adelante su negocio, generando más ingresos que le permitan cumplir el sueño a mediano plazo, de abrir un restaurante exclusivo, que sea reconocido por la buena sazón y el excelente servicio y así podrá brindarle a sus hijos una mejor educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Néstor is 35 years old, separated from his spouse, and the father of two children. His job experience began when he worked as a store clerk for various companies. However, due to his living situation, he accepted the opportunity to travel to the United States where he worked as a chef, preparing international foods for seven years. When he finally returned to Colombia, Néstor decided to start his own business with the money he saved during the years he had been working. In his business, he offers a variety of fast food dishes and has the help of two employees. His business is situated in a good location within a commercial area.

Néstor is an active and hardworking man who is passionate about his children and his profession. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in structural improvements (repair the floor of his business), print advertising leaflets, and buy supplies (fried meats, breads, sauces, and sodas) in order to generate more income. This will create a new image for his business, which will make his customers feel more comfortable. In addition, he will have available supplies that he needs to cater to the tastes of his customers. As a result, Néstor will be able to advance his business and succeed. By generating more income, he will be able to accomplish his midterm goal of opening an exclusive restaurant that will be recognized for its tasty food and excellent service. This will enable him to provide his children with a better education and improved quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for structural improvements to his shop, print advertising leaflets, and buy supplies for preparing his dishes.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He is 48 years old, married, and blessed with five children. Three of his children attend school. He operates a wholesale shop where he lives, and he is seeking to add another product line to his business. He got to know Milango through friends, and he joined. He has been able to borrow from Milango and Kiva as well. All the loans he has taken out were repaid without much difficulty. He has now applied for another loan to import cell phones for his shop. The major challenge that he deals with in his business is the unstable prices. The income that he produces with the loan will help him to send his children to school and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to import cell phones to add a new product line to his business.

loans.name: Arnoldus

texts.en:
Arnoldus is 19 years old. He is a man who has a passion to continue to develop his capabilities. He is now a prospective student who is enrolled at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He chose the Tehnika program. Arnoldus wants to be a professional technician on a ship. 

His parents work as potato farmers, and their income is very minimal -- just enough to live day-to-day as a family. They hope that Arnoldus will be able to complete his study and quickly get the job he wants. Arnoldus wants to make his parents happy. He wants to help his parents as well. 

Arnoldus has applied for a loan from Kiva to help him pay for his learning and cover all the needs of college. Arnoldus is very grateful to the lenders, who will help in his studies. He hopes this loan will also please his parents.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years.

loans.name: Haijar

texts.en:
Haijar is a 21-year-old married woman from Jabalia city. She lives in a simple house with her husband and two kids: a boy and a girl. Six months ago, Haijar and her husband opened a services office for students. They provide typing and printing services and also binding and packaging services. It is a profitable project and has no competitors in this area. 

Haijar would like to improve her business but she does not has enough capital. Haijar took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new copying machine and scanner. This will improve her business and increase her income. 

Haijer is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new copying machine and a scanner.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a 64-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He is a fisherman and catches fish, crab, and seashell. 

Ernesto is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy fishing materials such as a fish net, a crab net, and weights. He will use his loan to supplement his lack of capital and to increase his catch and income. In the future, Ernesto hopes that his business will improve and provide a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, a crab net, and weights

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a 31-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has two children, 11 and 13 years old.  She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells biscuits, canned goods, noodles, sugar, eggs, soaps, soft drinks and other products. Due to a shortage of capital to maintain her inventory, Alma applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more groceries and expand the diversity in her store. In the future, Alma would like to expand her store to provide her family with the best life.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and expand the diversity in her store.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 22-year-old single man from a village called Ellar near Tulkarem city. Haithem lives in an old house with his family. He works as a construction worker in the city and gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover all the necessary needs. Haitham would like to build a new home with better living conditions, but he does not have enough money. 

Haitham took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of construction materials like cement and iron for his new home. By taking this loan, Haitham will be able to start building his new home and live in it as soon as possible. 

Haitham appears in the photo in the place where he would like to build his home.

loans.use: to pay the costs of construction materials like cement and iron for his new home.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 33-year-old married man from Beit Sahour near Bethlehem. For the past few years, Ashraf has been working as a blacksmith in a workshop he owns. It is a profitable job, but very hard, and Ashraf needs to work long hours to earn a good income for his family. Ashraf's wife works as an employee and gets a good salary, so she can help her husband with part of the family's expenses and needs.

Ashraf took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some necessary home appliances like a refrigerator and a washing machine. This will improve the family's living conditions. 

Ashraf appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some necessary home appliances like a refrigerator and a washing machine

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo is a 49-year-old married man from Getafe, Bohol. He has nine children, the oldest of whom is 20 and the youngest is five. Teofilo runs a retail business selling bamboo which is used for fences, floors, and as a decorative material. He also is a fisherman and catches crab to augment his income. 

Teofilo is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan to buy a crab net and to purchase bamboo. He would like to expand both of his businesses to provide his growing children with good food and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a crab net and to purchase bamboo

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional supplies, including fabric, thread and buttons, for her tailoring business. Andrea has been in this business for 15 years. Andrea earns additional income from raising chickens. Andrea has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her business, including fabric, threads and buttons.

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en: Buenaventurada is 69 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Buenaventurada runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store, including snack foods, cooking oil, canned goods, coffee and sugar. Buenaventurada has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Buenaventurada would like to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy more items to sell  in her general store, including snack foods, cooking oil, canned goods, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 53 years old and married. She has three children.

Lida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an additional income from fish vending.

Lida requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Lida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia is 39 years old and married. She has four children.

Marcia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from food vending and karaoke rental.

Marcia requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods like canned goods, eggs, noodles, spices and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Marcia has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Marcia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like canned goods, eggs, noodles, spices and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married parent of eight children. She works selling coconut vinegar and also runs a general store. Jennifer works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her businesses through her previous six loans from NWTF.

Jennifer is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut vinegar to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut vinegar to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a candle-making business in the Philippines.

Yolanda requested a 14,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Yolanda has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 61 years old, married, and has three children.  Rosalina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalina applied for a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Rosalina has been raising pigs for six years, and she has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. Rosalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura runs a food cafe and a retail shop. She has had previous loans with Kiva and Milango. She was able to pay back the loans she took without much difficult. She plans to buy two bags of sugar, three bags of rice and two bags of beans. She has the ambition to own a wholesale shop within in the next five years. The challenge in her business is that clients don't pay on time. The extra income that she raises will pay for school for her children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of sugar, three bags of rice and two bags of beans for her business.

loans.name: Here's Group

texts.en:
Here is a 41-year-old mother who lives in a rural village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province with two children, one of whom is still in school and relies on her. Here sells cassava and corn as a main source of her family’s income. The current business, which she has been doing for 21 years, returns about 66,700KHR per day and she can manage to save only 15,000KHR after daily expenses.

This is the first cycle for Here with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She is seeking a loan of 800,000KHR while her joint group member is requesting  1,000,000KHR. 

As the leader, she will use this loan to buy cassava and corn to sell.  She hopes to increase her income to make a better living, and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cassava and corn to sell.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth was born in the village of Laung, Kapuas Hulu, West Kalimantan. She was the first child of three brothers. Her father is a rubber farmer whose income is uncertain. 

Elizabeth wants to go back to school. Her dream is to became expert in shipping and transportation management. Currently, Elizabeth is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN), in the program of Commercial Shipping and Harbor Management. Elizabeth chose AMN because her parents can not afford tuition and there is a student loan program because there is Kiva. So Elizabeth can achieve her goals without burdening her parents and can provide greater opportunities for younger siblings to attend school. 

This program gives great hope for her and her family. They are very happy because Elizabeth can attend lectures and achieve her goals. Elizabeth said, "But the excitement and hope is still dependent on the kindness of all of you. I depend on your generosity to lend me money for school fees. I promise to return it [after] I've graduated and am working. For your generosity, I say thank you."

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years.

loans.name: Nevaditas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NEVADITAS”  iniciará el décimo quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tenis, venta de ropa, elaboración de masitas, venta de celulares, venta de artículos varios, venta de CD’s, venta de artefactos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de ropa; este negocio lo emprendió hace cuarenta años aprendiendo primeramente el arte de la costura, posteriormente decide emprender su propio espacio de venta independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene doce hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nevaditas” is starting its 15th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Juana as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling tennis shoes, selling clothes, preparing snacks, selling mobile phones, selling general merchandise, selling CDs, and selling appliances.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Juana. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the organization. Juana currently has a sewing business and also sells the clothing that she makes. She started this business 40 years ago when she first learned the art of sewing. Later on, she decided to acquire her own space where she could sell independently.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying fabrics. She will acquire her supplies at the fairs in the city of El Alto and then use them to make her products at her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for maintaining her household. Juana is married and has 12 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Juana said that she enjoys the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lanie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Lanie is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mercidita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. 

Mercidita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks like snack foods, biscuits, candies, canned goods, etc., to sell in her general store.

Mercidita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like snack foods, biscuits, candies, canned goods, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nasri

texts.en:
Nasri is a 60-year-old married man from Jenin. He is a father of seven children: three boys and four girls. His children are either studying in school or university. 

Nasri was an employee in the public sector and he retired recently. His retirement salary is low and barely covers the family's needs. Nasri lives with his family in an old house which is not suitable and has very bad conditions. So he started to build his own home. He did not have enough money to complete it so he took a loan from FATEN. 

This loan will help him to complete building his new home especially buying tiles. By applying this loan, Nasri will be able to complete building his home and live in it with his family.

loans.use: to complete building his new home especially buying tiles

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 22-year-old single man from a small village called Bet Amin near Qalqilia city. He lives with his family in a small house in the village. Omar works as a construction worker and gets a low income. It is a seasonal job so his income is not stable.

Omar would like to build his own home so he will be independent and also to live in it when he gets married, but he does not have enough money to pay the costs of building his home.

Omar took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of construction materials for his new home especially cement and iron and stones.
This will help Omar to finish building his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay the costs of construction materials for his new home especially cement and iron

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 58 years old and married with six children. For the past nine years, she has run a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Juanita has received 17 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Juanita is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man from Beit hanoun near Jabalia city. He lives in a simple house with his family. For the past three years, Mohammad has had a bicycle store for selling and repairing bicycles. It is a good project since the city is very crowded and people have started using bicycles instead of cars. This will reduce fuel use and pollution.

Mohammad requested a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to improve his business by buying more bicycles and spare parts. This will improve his business and his income will be increased.

Mohammad appears in the photo while he was working in his store.

loans.use: to improve his business by buying more bicycles and spare parts

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is recorded as a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He will take the Tehnika program. 

Emanuel comes from a remote village, precisely in the village Raburia, Ende, East Nusa Tenggara region. With his marine geographic area, Emanuel is pushed to become a professional technician on a ship. 

His parents hope they can help Emanuel, but their income is only enough for their daily needs. His father works as a farmer, and he has to fend for his four children. 

Given the condition of his family, Emanuel hopes for the Student Loan Program from Kiva, in order to help finance his studies and ease the burden on his parents. He hopes to make happy the people he cares about, especially his parents. 

Emanuel is very grateful to Kiva investors from all over the world because they are helping him to achieve a better future.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years.

loans.name: Milagrina

texts.en:
Milagrina is 46 years old and married. She has four children, and one is currently in school. Milagrina works very hard to provide for them.

Milagrina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft-drinks, biscuits, noodles, bath soap, etc. 

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Milagrina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Abibatu.  She is married and has one child aged 2 years. In 2008, Abibatu established her used clothing business. She began her business because she used to assist her mother in selling used clothing after school.   When she dropped at of school, her mother gave her some money to start the same business.  

Working 5 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 985,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Abibatu requires a loan in order to purchase a bale of used clothing. 

In the future, Abibatu plans to expand the business and buy a piece of land. This loan will help to improve the business.  Some bales will not be of good quality.  Abibatu is hardworking businesswoman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of used clothing.

loans.name: Menday

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Menday. He is married and has no children.   

In 2010, Menday established his business selling clothing like polo shirts, crepe, shoes, shirt, jeans, sandals, belts, bags, coats, etc. He began his business because he is a graduate but decided to go into business because of the struggle in getting a job in the country. His father gave him some amount of money to start business. 

Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 905,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.  Menday requires a loan in order to buy jeans, polo shirts and shoes. In the future, Menday plans to become an international businessman, build a house and open another outlet. This loan will help to expand the business. 

Inadequate capital is his main challenge. He is a hardworking businessman. He thanks you for providing financial support for business people. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans, polo shirts and shoes.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana works hard to support her family. Rosana has a refreshments business in the Philippines.

Rosana requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of goods to sell like soft drinks, juices, bread, etc.

Rosana has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods to sell like soft drinks, juices, bread, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is 49 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making nipa roofing material woven from palm fronds. Ma. Dolores is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Ma. Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Responsables está conformado por 9 integrantes madres solteras con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
La coordinadora del banco comunal es Erika Patricia y tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanía como casa de barros, jarrones, floreros, muñecas, tinajas, ella dedica a su actividad unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su mercadería. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de artesanía para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Mujeres responsables agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brinda a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Responsables is made up of 9 members who are all single mothers with a total of 15 children under their care. These women are known for being hard working, responsible, and with the desire to be successful. Unfortunately, they could not study because they lacked the economic resources to do so, and they found themselves obligated to work from an early age. They seek to offer a brighter future to their children.
The coordinator of the communal bank is Erika Patricia who sells handmade crafts like clay homes, decorative vases, flower vases, dolls, and clay jars. She runs this business for eight hours a day. The objective of the credit is to be able to invest in her work and stock her business so she can continue to purchase and sell handmade goods so that in the future she will be able to earn more income. The communal bank she is a member of is thankful for the help of the lenders at Kiva who loan money to those with little resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua so that people like these women can have dignified work.

loans.use: purchase handmade crafts such as vases, dolls and clay jars.

loans.name: Marriane

texts.en:
Marriane is 27 years old with two children, one of whom in school. For the past four years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Marriane works very hard to provide for her family.

Marriane is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, soap, snack foods, soft drinks, and other products. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, soap, snack foods, soft drinks, and other products

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is married and works hard to support her family. For the past ten years, she has operated a rice-vending business in the Philippines.

Jenny is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mirian Janeth

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 34 años de edad de estado civil Casada tiene una hija vive con el esposo y con la hija en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

mirian se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir sembrando y aumentar la produccion le gusta salir a caminar con la hija.
texts.en:
Mirian is 34 years old, married, and has one daughter. She lives with her husband and daughter in the rural area of Mina de Piedra, which is in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

Mirian belongs to the communal bank “30 de Noviembre”, which is also located in Mina de Piedra. Mirian works in agriculture and livestock.

Mirian grows corn and raises farmyard animals such as chickens and pigs. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, manure, insecticides to prevent pests and diseases, and balanced feed for her animals. She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas. Her dream is to buy land to continue growing crops and to increase her production. She likes to go for walks with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides to prevent pests and diseases, and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of assorted plastic shoes.

loans.name: Myden

texts.en:
Myden is 22 years old and married with one child. For the past five years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Myden is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Myden is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items such as canned goods, milk, soap, egg, noodles, and other products to sell. In the future, she would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, soap, egg, noodles, and other products

loans.name: Ndeye Sow

texts.fr: La  dame   NDEYE   SOW  est   mariée   et   habite   près  du guichet de l’UIMCEC ou elle est membre et qui situé non loin de sa zone d’habitation. Elle a  déjà bénéficié de 3 prêts antérieurs au sein  de la dite institution. Elle pratique la vente de poissons et sollicite un crédit de  100 000 frs prévu pour le renforcement de son fond de roulement. Elle  capitalise une expérience de 5 ans dans son activité de commerce qu’elle souhaite développer davantage. De  ce fait l’accroissement de ses revenus lui permettra de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise en démarrant la vente de sandwich. Elle ambitionne aussi d’épargner de l’argent et disposer d’une cantine.
texts.en: Madame Ndeye   Sow Is married and lives near the l’UIMCEC branch office where she is a member. She has already had the benefit of three prior loans from this institution. She sells fish and is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs to add to her working capital. She is making the most of an experience of five years in her commercial activity which she would like to further develop. Therefore, growing her income will permit her to diversify what she is selling, starting by selling sandwiches. Her ambition is to save up some money and have a shop.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ada works hard to support her family. She runs a bakery in the Philippines. Ada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now is requesting a new loan to further build her bakery business.

Ada is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients such as flour, margarine, corn starch, and other products for her bakery. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy flour, margarine, corn starch, and other products

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 46 years old and married with four children. For the past two years, she has been earning a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Eva is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Yusenis Pahola

texts.es: Yusenis a sus 29 años de edad es separada y madre de dos hijos de 4 y 9 años. Hace diez años se dedica a la confección, debido a que laboró en dos empresas grandes y así adquirió experiencia, gracias a esto inició su propio taller, en sociedad con una amiga, pero por cuestiones personales tuvo inconvenientes con ella y la sociedad se terminó. A pesar de todas las dificultades por las que ha pasado, Yusenis decidió seguir adelante y hace 6 años montó su propio taller de confección, donde le brinda empleo directo a seis personas, y le presta el servicio a terceros; es así como ha logrado obtener ingresos para su hogar, pues es quien lleva toda la carga económica por ser madre cabeza de familia. Sus hijos y su trabajo son la motivación que la impulsa a buscar opciones para salir adelante, por eso solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de 2 máquinas (máquina plana y máquina recubridora), para poder agilizar el proceso de producción y poder brindar empleo a 2 personas más, de esta forma obtendrá los recursos suficientes para ahorrar y comprar su casa propia, ya que sueña con brindarle una mejor educación y calidad de vida a sus dos pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Yusenis is 29 years old, separated from her spouse, and the mother of two children (ages 4 and 9). She has been working as a seamstress for 10 years. Yusenis acquired her experience by working for two large companies before partnering with a friend to start their own workshop. The partnership ended because of personal differences. Despite all of the difficulties she has endured, Yusenis decided to press forward and open her own workshop, which she did six years ago. She provides jobs for six employees and her services are offered to third parties. This enables her to generate income for her family since she has full responsibility as a female head of household. Her children and her work are what motivate her to seek out options that will allow her to succeed.

With the loan she requested, Yusenis will invest in the purchase of two machines (a tabletop sewing machine and a cover stitch machine) that are needed to streamline her production process. This will also create jobs for two additional people. As a result, Yusenis will be able to save a sufficient amount of her income for buying a house of her own. Her dream is to provide a better education and an improved quality of life for her two young children.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine and a cover stitch machine.

loans.name: Maura Elena

texts.es:
La  señora  Maura  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con su hijo y esposo  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   compra y venta  de  cobertores de cama  y también vende cerdos  desde hace más de 10 años. 
Doña Maura el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  cobertores y unos cerditos  con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener Doña Maura más producto que ofrece a sus clientes. 
Doña Maura espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando que sus padres e hijo   ya  que  son de  escasos recurso  económicos. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Junio  del   2013
texts.en:
Maura is responsible, hardworking and honest. She lives with her son and husband in the south of Honduras. Her business is buying and selling bedspreads, as well as selling pigs, which she has done for more than 10 years now.

Maura is requesting this loan to buy bedspreads and piglets. With the loan she hopes to increase her sales by having more product to offer to her customers.

Maura hopes to cover the needs of her family and improve their quality of life. She hopes that in the next few years her business will continue to grow and will become one of the largest and most recognized businesses in her area. She also hopes to continue supporting her parents and her son, as they have few economic resources.

Choluteca, Honduras – June 2013

loans.use: to buy bedspreads and piglets for her business.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Ana  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo y sus hijos  en  un caserío al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  venta    de golosinas.  
Doña Ana tiene su negocio desde hace más de 12 años y necesita el préstamo para la compra  de  carnes, maíz, manteca,  azúcar,  colorantes, huevos, frijoles, queso, lechuga, tomates, condimentos etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder así atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Doña Ana espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de los más reconocido de la zona.
Doña Ana su sueño es que sus  hijos  se gradúen y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la   sociedad y  ayudar  a su  familia 	



Choluteca, Honduras  –  Junio   del   2013
texts.en:
Ana is an honest, responsible and hard-working person. She lives with her husband and children in a village in southern Honduras. Her business is selling snacks. 

Ana has had her business for more than 12 years and needs the loan to purchase meat, corn, butter, sugar, food coloring, eggs, beans, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, condiments, etc. She hopes the loan will increase her sales by having more product to offer and therefore better serve her customers. 

Ana hopes to meet her needs and improve the quality of life a little for her and her family. In a few years she hopes her business keeps growing and becomes one of the most recognized in the area. Her dream is that her children graduate, become good people with more opportunities in the community and help their family.

Choluteca, Honduras  –  June 2013

loans.use: to purchase meat, corn, butter, sugar, food coloring, eggs, beans, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, condiments, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy tiene 24 años, está divorciada y vive en su casa propia junto su único hijo. Cindy se dedica a la venta de ropas de segundo uso, de buena calidad y modelos varados, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Se inició hace más de 03 años con un capital prestado de Microfinanzas Prisma, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando en sociedad con su sobrina quien le ayuda buscar nuevos clientes. Se decido a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos ya que le faltaba para cubrir sus necesidades. Por tanto, viendo las ganancias que le deja, desea invertir en la venta de jugos de frutas por las mañanas, así aumentara sus ingresos. Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva.  Por lo tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto de 500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de ropas variadas, y golosinas para vender en su casa.
texts.en:
Cindy is 24 years old, is divorced and lives in her own house with her only son. She earns a living selling good quality second hand clothing in a variety of styles for men, women and children. She began 3 years ago with a loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and up until now she has been working in partnership with her niece who helps her to find new customers. She decided to start her business because she needed an income to cover her expenses, since she did not have sufficient to cover her needs. After seeing the profits she gets from the business, she now wants to invest in selling fruit juices in the mornings, which will increase her income.

This will be her first loan with Kiva so she is hoping for your support to be able to continue with her objectives. She will use the sum of 500 nuevos soles to buy various clothing and sweets to sell at home.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing to sell in her business.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: Ramona, está casado, tiene la edad de 56 años, actualmente vive con sus hijos y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar lo insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su cafetal, ella comprara abonos y todas las fumigaciones necesarias para mantener su plantación en buen estado.  Ella espera poder obtener este año un buen aumento o mejora de su cosecha para poder mejorar su estabilidad económica y tener un futuro menos incierto con su vivencia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ramona runs a coffee plantation. She is 56, married, and lives with her husband and children; her family is her top priority. Ramona will use funds from this loan to purchase supplies she needs to maintain the health of her coffee trees: manure and fumigants. Ramona hopes to increase her harvest this year, which would provide broad benefits to her family. A better harvest would stabilize the family's finances, reduce uncertainty, and ensure a better future. This is Ramona's first loan with FUDECOSUR, though she's borrowed from state banks in the past. FUDECOSUR, however, offers a simpler loan process and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: Comprar insumos para la asitencia de cafe

loans.name: Kotongnontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotongnontala, est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 50 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Dioïla quartier Tripano, commune de Dioila, préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, condiments, du miel, des légumes.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Kotongnontala sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter leurs marchandises.
La cliente Mossodje  debout au  milieu, compte acheter 12 pagnes chez les grossistes qui sera vendu à Dioïla et elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir au dépenses de la famille et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group Kotongnontala is composed of married women, who average 50 years of age and six children each, all living in traditional extended families in Dioïla, in the Tripano district, Commune de Dioila, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in clothing, condiments, honey, and vegetables. 

The women of the group Kotongnontala are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase their merchandise.

This client, Mossodje, who is standing in the middle in the photo, intends to purchase 12 lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) from wholesalers. The goods will be sold in Dioïla. She envisions making a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover family expenses and pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Wend La Boumbou Group

texts.fr:
Mr  ISSAKA représente le groupe WEND LA BOUMBOU. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 01 va à l’école et il a 03 personnes en charge.
Il est couturier depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne  au grand marché . Ses clients  sont les  hommes, femmes et enfants.
Mr veut s’acheter une machine à coudre et rouleau de tissus, des boutons et des fermetures.
IL  veut épargner ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne agrandir son atelier et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Mr. ISSAKA represents the group WEND LA BOUMBOU. He is a married father of two children. The oldest is 8 years old, and the youngest is 5. One goes to school, and he has three persons to support. 

Mr. ISSAKA has been clothing maker for ten years. He gets his supplies from the big market. His customers include men, women, and children.

He wants to purchase a sewing machine, rolls of fabrics, buttons, and zippers. He wants to save his profits to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to expand his workshop and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, rolls of fabrics, buttons, and zippers

loans.name: Rogelio José

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio José  es  casado y se dedica a la actividad de compra y venta de reloj, lentes y carteras con la que ha desarrollado su familia llevando el sustento a su hogar. Cabe mencionar que es un señor  muy entusiasta y con muchos deseos de superación.

Por eso acudió a  Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para comprar reloj, lentes y carteras de calidad  y así satisfacer a su clientela en precios y calidad.

Y  así   obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, ya que esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 12 años, teniendo buenos resultados en sus ventas.
texts.en: Rogelio José is married and works buying and selling watches, glasses and wallets, a business his family developed to earn a living for the household. It is worth mentioning that he is a very enthusiastic man with many wishes for self-improvement. For this reason he turned to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan to purchase quality watches, glasses and wallets and thereby satisfy his clientele with good quality and prices. In this way he will earn an income for the benefit of his family since he has been doing this work for 12 years with good results in his sales.

loans.use: to purchase watches, glasses and wallets.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi, est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font essentiellement le commerce de condiments et d’habillements.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter leurs marchandises.
La cliente Sali la personne à droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter 50 kg d’oignon, 10kg de l’ail et 25kg de sel. L’achat se fait chaque semaine au marché. Ces produis seront vendus en détail en vue de réaliser un bénéfice par semaine 7.500FCFA. 
Ce bénéfice est utilisé pour certaines dépenses de la familiale et  pour les échéances du prêt.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi is composed of married women, who average 33 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in Dioïla, in the Tripano district, Commune de Dioila, Préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They essentially do commerce in condiments and clothing. 

The women of the group Benkadi are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase their merchandise.

This client, Sali, who is standing at the right in the photo, intends to purchase 50 kg of onions, 10 kg of garlic, and 25 kg of salt. The purchases are made each week at the market. These products will be sold retail with the aim of making a weekly profit of 7,500 francs CFA. This profit will be used for certain family expenses and to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Djiguiya Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe DJIGUIYA  III sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Sokourani un des villages de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, du mil et du sésame. Elles sont à leur quatrième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Djeneba la première personne à gauche  dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice moyen de 125 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of "DJIGUIYA III" are married women, who average 36 years of age and three children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Sokourani, a village in Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are peanuts, millet, and sesame. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. 

With this loan, Djeneba, who is the first person standing from the left in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain about 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce will be sold to men and women customers in Marka Coungo City. She hopes to make profit of about 125,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry equipment

loans.name: Djiguiya  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe DJIGUIYA II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Sokourani un des villages de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, du mil et du sésame. Elles sont à leur quatrième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Djeneba la deuxième personne à droite  dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice  de 135 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of "DJIGUIYA II" are married women, who average 42 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Sokourani, a village in Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are peanuts, millet, and sesame. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. 

With this loan, Djeneba, who is the second person standing from the right in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to maintain about 1 hectare of millet and peanuts. 

After the harvest, the produce will be sold to men and women customers in Marka Coungo City. She hopes to make profit of about 135,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry equipment

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal las palomas está conformado por diez integrantes ocho mujeres y dos hombres, madres y padres de familia con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, y han tenido que trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Y luchan día  a día para  brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
La coordinadora del banco comunal Las Palomas es Juana María y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, jabón, cuajada, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciéndole sus productos para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El banco comunal  Las Palomas agradece la ayuda de los inversionistas kiva le brinda a persona de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Las Palomas communal bank is comprised of ten members, eight women and two men.  They are parents with 20 children for whom they are responsible.  They are from Sauce, which is located in the northern part of the country.  They are known for being hard-working and responsible and for having the desire for personal improvement.  Sadly, they were not able to get an education due to lack of financial resources.  At a young age they had to work in order to help with the household expenses.  They struggle day to day in order to give their children a better future.

Juana María is the coordinator of the Las Palomas communal bank.  Her business activity is a “pulpería”, which is located in her house.  A “pulpería” is a small store that sells food products in small amounts like rice, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, soap, curds, juices, and soft drinks.  She works in her  business 12 hours a day.  She sells her products so that, in the not so distant future, she will be able to get better earnings.

The Las Palomas communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent way of earning a living.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Elvia Johana

texts.es:
La  señora  Elvia es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su hijo en el  sur de Honduras, Su negocio es  la   venta  de cosméticos y detergentes. 
Doña Elvia El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de   desinfectantes,  lociones, perfumes, cremas, talcos, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Doña Elvia espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno  de los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona.
Doña Elvia sueña con ver a su hijo graduado y todo un profesional convertido en una persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Junio   del   2013
texts.en:
Elvia is a responsible, hard-working and honest person who lives with her son in the south of Honduras. Her business is selling cosmetics and detergents.

Elvia needs the loan to purchase disinfectants, lotions, perfumes, creams, talcs, etc. With this loan she hopes that her business's sales will increase by having more product to offer and better attending to her customers needs.

Elvia hopes to cover her necessities and improve her own and her families' quality of life a little. And she hopes that during the next few years her business will continue growing and it can be converted into one of the larger and more recognized businesses in the zone.

Elvia dreams of seeing her son graduate and become a professional, developing into a good person with greater opportunities in life.

loans.use: buy disinfectants, lotions, perfumes, creams, talcs, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn works hard to support her family. Marlyn is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Marlyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Pia Mahal

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Pia Mahal works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Pia Mahal is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy foods and household goods to sell like sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Pia Mahal has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy foods and household goods to sell like sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 36 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, shampoo, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Christine has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport, raising chickens, and rice retailing.

Christine aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, shampoo, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Imelda is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Imelda has a auto repair shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts and other items for her shop.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her auto repair shop.

Imelda has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and other materials for her shop

loans.name: Monalie

texts.en:
Monalie works hard to support her family. Monalie is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Monalie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Monalie  would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Charlie works hard to support her family. She has a travelling business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She earns additional income from farming vegetables. Charlie is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her ambulant vending business.

Charlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguisseme  est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massigui, quartier de Sirifila, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, des habillements, de condiments, et de la restauration.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leurs vingt unième prêts solidaires qui sera utilisé pour acheter des céréales, l’habillement les condiments du riz pour la restauration.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
La deuxième personne à partir de la droite s’appelle Djeneba. Elle compte acheter avec son argent , 12 pagnes wax et 15 pagnes Bazin qui seront vendus à ses clientes au marché et à domicile, en détail et au comptant.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen par semaine de 20 000FCFA ce qui fait 80.000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour ouvrir boutique et une partie sera réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The members of "Djiguisseme" are married women, who average 40 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional extended families in Massigui, in the Sirifila district, Commune de Massigui, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, clothing, and condiments, and they work in food service. 

The women of the group Djiguisseme are on their 21st solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase some grains, clothing, and condiments and rice for catering. 

The second person from the right in the photo is called Djeneba. She intends to use the money to purchase 12 lengths of Wax cloth and 15 lengths of damask that will be sold retail to customers paying cash at the market and at the house. 

She envisions making an average weekly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which makes 80,000 francs a month. This profit will be used to open a store, and some of it will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Valiree

texts.en:
Valiree is 23 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Valiree runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, milk, coffee, soft drinks, chips, eggs, etc.

Valiree has been in this business for five years. In the future Valiree would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, milk, coffee, soft drinks, chips, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Ella tiene un negocio de pulpería donde vende refrescos, azúcar, granos básicos, golosinas como churros, dulces, pan, galletas etc., el negocio lleva 10 años de existir y está ubicado en su casa. El préstamo que Marina solicito es por L.16, 000 el cual es el cuarto ciclo con ODEF y lo invertirá en la compra de productos para surtir el negocio como granos básicos, azúcar, refrescos, golosinas, lácteos, y otros abarrotes. Su meta es seguir trabajando con el negocio para mejorar su bienestar personal y de su familia.
texts.en:
Marina, 42, is a single mother; she has a daughter and lives in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  She has a grocery store where she sells soft-drinks, sugar, basic grains and snacks like packaged snacks, candy, bread, cookies, etc.  The business has been in existence for 10 years and is located at home.  

The loan Marina requested is for 16,000 Lempiras and it’s her fourth ODEF cycle; she will use it to buy products like basic grains, sugar, soft-drinks, snacks, dairy products and others to stock her store.  Her goal is to continue working in her business to improve her personal and her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo, est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 50 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de l’habillement, des fruits et les légumes, des chaussures et de la cosmétique.                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo  sont à leur vingtième   prêt solidaire. La cliente Yeh  1 ère  à gauche compte acheter des chaussures et de la pommade à Bamako. Son cycle d’achat est mensuel. Elle vend en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25000 FCFA, qui sera utilise pour rembourser le prêt et aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Djekafo is composed of married women, who average 50 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in Fana City, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, clothing, fruit & vegetables, shoes, and cosmetic products. 

The women of the group Djekafo are on their 20th solidarity loan.

This client, Yeh, who is first at the left in the photo, intends to purchase shoes and ointments from Bamako. Her buying cycle is monthly. She sells retail to men and women customers paying cash. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and help her husband to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods, such as fruit & vegetables, shoes, and cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Zoirjon

texts.ru: Зоирчон молодой женатый человек в возрасте 22-х лет. Он живет с женой, дочерью, родителями и младшим братом в районе Рудаки. Отец Зоирчона работает мигрантом в России. Все расходы семьи сейчас на его плечи. Зоирчон хочет тоже начать работать. Так как у него имеются водительские права и опыт вождения, он собирается заняться услугой по перевозке пассажиров. Зоирчон за счет денежных переводов отца отложил немного денег в размере 5000 TJS. Он нуждается в денежной сумме еще в размере 1200 долларов США. Зоирчон запрашивает данну сумму в кредит. Он хочет купить малогабаритный микроавтобус марки Hafei Zhongyi для начала услуги по перевозке пассажиров. Зоирчон планирует работать с девяти утра до девяти вечера по маршрутной линии своего района и совершать в день 8 рейсов. Он будет очень признателен за поддержку.
texts.en:
Zoirjon is a young married man of 22. He lives with his wife, daughter, parents and younger brother in the Rudaki region. Zoirjon's father is a migrant worker in Russia. All the family expenses are now on his shoulders. Zoirjon also wants to start working. Since he has his driver's license and driving experience, he is going to start passenger transport services. 

Remittances from Zoirjon's father come to a small amount, only 5,000 TJS. He still needs a sum of money USD$1,200. Zoirjon is requesting this amount as a loan. He wants to buy a compact minivan of the brand Hafei Zhongyi to start passenger transportation services. 

Zoirjon plans to work from nine in the morning until nine at night along the transport routes of his district and to make eight trips per day. He will be very grateful for the support.

loans.use: to purchase a compact minivan of the brand Hafei Zhongyi to start passenger transportation services

loans.name: Les Soeurs Unies Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATOUMATA représente le groupe LES SŒURS UNIS. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 04 vont à l’école.
Elle vend du bois de chauffe  et charbon de bois depuis 06ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les provinces avec les camions. Ses clients  sont les femmes du quartier.
Mme veut s’acheter 02 rangées de bois et 03 sacs de charbon.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices pour renforcer ses activités. Elle ambitionne agrandir  son champ d’activité et subvenir au besoin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mme Fatoumata represents the group called  Les Soeurs Unies. She is married and the mother of five children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest three years old. Four of them attend school. 

She sells firewood and charcoal and has been doing this for six years. She buys her firewood in the back country using trucks. Her customers are women from her neighborhood. 

She wants to buy two loads of firewood and three sacks of charcoal. She wants to save her profits to expand her business. Her ambition is to extend her area of business and be able to afford the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy two loads of wood and three sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Natalia tiene 63 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Villanueva junto a uno de sus hijos y su nuera. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas como ser churros, galletas, refrescos, jugos, confites, chicles etc. Tiene varios años de tener este negocio ofreciendo diferentes productos. Anteriormente se dedicaba a realizar trabajos domésticos en casas. Para seguir manteniendo el negocio ha solicitado otro préstamo que es por 5,000 Lempiras, este es el segundo ciclo en ODEF, el cual los invertirá en la compra de más productos de golosinas para surtir y poder hacer que su negocio vaya creciendo poco a poco. Su meta es lograr establecer una pulpería.
texts.en: Natalia is 63 years old. She is a widow and has two children. She lives in the town of Villanueva with a son and daughter-in-law. She has a business selling snacks like churros, cookies, soft drinks, juice, candy, gum, etc. She has been in business for several years, offering different products.
