She used to work as a domestic in homes. In order to keep her business going, she is requesting another loan, which will be her second cycle in ODEF. She will invest the 5,000 lempiras in more snack products to stock her business so that it can grow little by little. Her goal is to be able to set up a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase snack products like churros, cookies, soft drinks, sweets, etc.

loans.name: María Elva

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Ella es una persona con mucha responsabilidad; se dedica a la criá de ganado lechero, a la producción de leche y a la elaboración de queso duro blando. Desde pequeña su papá le enseño el arte de mantenimiento del ganado y la elaboración de queso; que hoy en día ella sigue haciéndolo para no perder la tradición y el legado que su padre le dejara.

 Se levanta a las 2:00 a.m. de la madrugada para poder ordeñar las vaca; ya que ella no cuenta con trabajadores la mayoría de veces le ayuda su padre, luego de que ella saca la leche la deposita en un recipiente para llevarla al pueblo a vender.

      Para que la señora María, pueda comprar el alimento y las medicina de los animales; tiene que trasladarse al pueblo para  que esta a una distancia de 4 kilómetros, se transporta en un vehículo prestado, para  llevar el alimento y las medicina hasta su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para el mantenimiento del ganado; ya que es la fuente de dinero que tiene para obtener el alimento de sus hijos y de sus padres, debido a que ellos viven en la casa con ella.  

Al proporcionales un buen mantenimiento a su ganado, producirá más leche y evitara que su ganado se contagie de alguna enfermedad como hongo en la pesuñas la que provoca patojera y eso provoca disminución de la leche y le afecta a ella si no tiene las medicina para curarlas.

Ella planea que en el futuro siempre seguir trabajando con la fundación Campo, ya que manifiesta que le dieron la oportunidad de trabajar con la agencia y que también al terminar este crédito solicitara otro mas para el mantenimiento del ganado.
texts.en:
María, 43, has two children.  She’s a very responsible woman who works raising dairy cattle, producing milk and hard and soft cheese.  Since she was little her father taught her to care for the cattle and to make cheese and today she continues to do so in order not to lose the tradition and legacy her father left her.

She rises at 2am to be able to milk the cows because she doesn’t have any workers; most of the time her father helps her.  Once she extracts the milk she deposits in into a receptacle to take it to town to sell.

In order for María to be able to buy feed and medicine for the animals she has to head into a town that’s 4 kilometers away.  She uses a borrowed vehicle to bring the feed and medicines home.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to care for the cattle because it’s the only source of income she has to get food for her children and her parents who live at home with her.

By providing good care for her cattle more milk will be produced and she’ll avoid her cattle falling ill to any illness like a hoof fungus that causes them to waddle and leads to a lessening of milk production and if she doesn’t have the medicine to cure them this affects her.

She plans in future to always continue to work with Fundación Campo because she says they gave her the opportunity to work with the agency and when she finishes with this loan she will request another one for cattle maintenance.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Danaya, est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massigui, quartier de Sirifila, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales,  des habillements,  des condiments, et de la restauration avec la préparation vente du haricot.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leurs vingt unième prêts solidaires qui sera utilisé pour acheter des céréales, des habillements des condiments et du haricot  pour la restauration.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
La cliente Sali, la personne assise de la droite vers la gauche est vendeuse de haricot chaque Mercredi à la foire, elle compte acheter avec son prêt 100kg de haricot, 10kg de beurre de karité. En plus du marché, elle vend nuits et jours à domicile. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen par semaine de 21000FCFA ce qui fait 84000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour agrandir sa table de vente et construire un petit magasin.
texts.en:
The group Danaya is composed of married women, who average 47 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Massigui, in the Sirifila district, Commune de Massigui, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, clothing, and condiments, and they work in food service. 

The women of the group Danaya are on their 21st solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase grains, clothing, and condiments and some beans for the restaurant business.

This client, Sali, who is sitting at the right in the photo, sells beans each Wednesday at the fair. She intends to use her loan to purchase 100 kg of beans and 10 kg of shea butter. In addition to the market, she sells day and night out of her home. She envisions making an average weekly profit of 21,000 francs CFA, which is 84,000 francs a month. This profit will be used to expand her sales table and to build a small store.

loans.use: to purchase beans for her restaurant

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yiriwa, est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana,  préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de l’habillement, des fruits et les légumes.                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Yiriwa sont à leur vint septième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
La cliente Bintou  2 eme de la droite vers la gauche  compte acheter 5 rouleaux de pagnes à Bamako. Son cycle d’achat est chaque deux semaines et sa clientèle est majoritairement féminine.  
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
The group called Yiriwa  is made up of married women who have an average age of 37, four children, and all live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They met through ties of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. They sell condiments, clothing, and fruit and vegetables.  The women of the Yiriwa group are on their seventh solidarity loan which will be used to buy the above-mentioned merchandise.

Bintou, the second from right to left, intends to buy five rolls of African print cloth in Bamako. She goes there to stock up every two weeks and most of her clientele is composed of women. She hopes to make an average profit of 45,500 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and contribute to family expenditures.

loans.use: to buy lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkola, est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 50 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massigui, quartier de Sirifila, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de la couture à la main et la vente  d’habillements.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Benkola sont à leur vingtième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des céréales, les tissus et files e des habillements.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
La cliente Mariam, la première à droite dans le rang des debout compte acheter avec cet argent  quelques mètre de tissus et du file à coudre. Elle même coud en confectionnant des dessins. Ces pagnes seront vendus à ses clientes au marché et à domicile.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen par semaine de 20 000FCFA ce qui fait 80000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour acheter une vache laitière et une partie sera réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group Benkola is composed of married women, who average 50 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional extended families in the village of Massigui, in the Sirifila district, Commune de Massigui, Préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, make clothing by hand, and sell clothing. 

The women of the group Benkola are on their 20th solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase grains, fabrics and thread, and clothing.

This client, Mariam, who is standing first from the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase a few meters of cloth and some thread for sewing. She even sews clothing from sketches. This traditional clothing is sold to customers at the market and at her home. She envisions making an average weekly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which is 80,000 francs a month. This profit will be used to purchase a milk cow, and some will be reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread

loans.name: Alina

texts.es:
Alina tiene 40 años, está divorciada y vive en su casa propia junto sus 3 hijos. Alina  se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros para lo cual cuenta con 02 motocarros, los cuales alquila. Lleva en este negocio casi 02 años. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos, además del tiempo libre de le deja y lo puede emplear en otras actividades, por otro lado, de considerarlo rentable, teniendo bastante demanda, y con sus ganancias tiene planes de abrir un negocio de venta de lubricantes para motos y motocarros.
Este será su segundo préstamo con Kiva. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas.
Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento de sus motocarros como llantas y otros.
texts.en:
Alina is forty years old. She is divorced and lives in her own home with her three children. Alina provides passenger transportation services, which is why she has two three-wheelers, which she rents. She has been in this business almost two years. She enjoys her work because it generates financial income but also allows her free time to dedicate to other activities. On the other hand, she considers it profitable and has quite a bit of demand. With her profits she plans to open a store selling lubricants for motorcycles and three-wheelers.

This will be her second loan through Kiva. She is very happy knowing that she will have financial support, because that will give her confidence in advancing her business. She promises to make her payments on time. 

She will invest the amount of 1,000 nuevos soles in purchasing spare parts like tires and other items to maintain her three-wheelers.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her three-wheelers.

loans.name: Ana Iveth

texts.es:
La Joven  Ana  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  sus  2 hijos y su  esposo en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta  de   granitas desde hace más de 2 años. 
Ana el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de una  máquina  para hacer  granitas,  azúcar y frutas. Con el crédito  ella espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con otra máquina y producto para la elaboración de sus granitas.
Ana espera cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo espera que mejore su situación económica y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como uno de los más grandes y  conocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad .



Choluteca, Honduras –  Junio  del 2013
texts.en:
Young Ana is a very enterprising woman living with her two children and her husband in a community in southern Honduras.  Her business for the last two years has been selling shaved ice treats.  Ana needs the loan to buy a machine to shave ice, sugar and fruit.  She hopes the loan will help her increase sales because she’ll be able to rely on an additional shave ice machine and products to make the shaved ice treats.

Ana hopes to cover her needs and also hopes to improve her economic situation and with this investment.  In a few years she dreams with having a well-positioned business that’s one of the largest and best-known in the zone to be able to continue supporting her family so they will become people who are beneficial to society.

Choluteca, Honduras – June, 2013

loans.use: to buy a machine, fruit and sugar.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru: Марджона молодая и энергичная девушка. Ей 19 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она после окончания средней школы поступила в Политехнический Университет Таджикистана. Она учится в факультете Программист – экономист. Марджона любит такие предметы как алгебра, геометрия, физика, химия, английский язык и т.п. Она добрая и чистосердечная девушка. Ее родители гордятся ею. Марджона мечтает после окончания университета, стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора.
texts.en:
Marjona is an energetic young woman. She is 19 years old. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. After graduating high school, she enrolled in the Tajikistan Political University. She is studying in the Programming department to be an economist. Marjona loves subjects such as algebra, geometry, physics, chemistry, English, and the like. She is a kind and upright young woman. Her parents are proud of her. 

Marjona dreams after graduation of becoming a highly qualified specialist. She needs to pay for her school frees, but doesn't have the money. She is requesting a loan to pay for tuition.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition at the university

loans.name: Doris Janeth

texts.es:
La joven Doris es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con su hijo y esposo  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   compra y venta  de vacas desde hace más de 6 años.
Doris el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  vacas,  con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más ganado y poder atender mejor  a sus clientes. 
Doris espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona  y  seguir  apoyando que sus padres e hijo   ya  que  son de  escasos recurso  económicos. 	




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Junio  del   2013
texts.en:
Young Doris is a responsible, hardworking, honest woman living with her husband and son in south Honduras.  Her business is buying and selling cows; she’s been in business more than six years.

Doris needs the loan to buy cows.  Her business sales will increase with the loan by having more cattle and being able to better serve customers.

Doris hopes to meet the needs she has and improve her and her family’s quality of life a little.  In a few years she hopes her business will continue to grow and become one of the largest and best-known in the zone so she can continue supporting her parents and son who have low economic resources.

Choluteca, Honduras - June, 2013

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Ilyos

texts.ru: Илёс очень трудолюбивый человек и мастер в сельскохозяйственном деле. Он уроженец село Ниёзбек, Канибадамского района. Илёс арендует землю и занимается выращиванием риса в своем селе. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве и помогает ему в сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Двое  их сыновей находятся в миграции на территории РФ. Илёс челевек перспективный и намеривающий развивать свою деятельность. Доходы, которые он и его семья  получают, в основном расходуются для их потребления и кормления семьи. Поэтому, для реализации своих планов, он обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.   Полученный кредит, Илёс хочет  использовать  для покупки семян для выращивания риса,  и  часть кредит использует для оплаты аренды.  Илёс заранее выражает огромную   благодарность Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Ilyos is a very hardworking man and a master in the agricultural trade. He is a native of the village Niyozbek, in the Kanibadam region. Ilyos rents land and is engaged in growing rice in his village. His wife works in a collective farm and helps him in the agricultural activities. Two of their sons are migrant works in the Russian Federation. 

Ilyos is a forward-looking person and intends to develop his activities. The income that he and his family receive is mostly spent on consumables and feeding the family. Therefore to implement his plans, he appealed to Arvand for financial support. Ilyos wants to use the resulting loan to buy seeds for growing rice, and part of the loan will be used to pay rent. Ilyos expresses his wholehearted appreciation in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 53 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, chips, etc..

Carmelita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from bamboo weaving.

Carmelita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 38 years old, married and has one child who is in school.  She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou  né en  juillet 1988, célibataire sans enfant, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à Fana quartier Banakabougou commune de Guégnaka, cercle de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro République du Mali. 
Monsieur Seydou est installé à son compte et exerce le commerce de matériels de couture  il y’a maintenant  deux ans. Il s’approvisionne en matériels, à Bamako chaque 15 jours et  vend à Fana en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. Il détient une boutique aux abords du goudron dans la ville de Fana. Il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour mieux organiser son activité. Il compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des paquets bobines de files, des aiguilles, des boutons et des presses- boutons. Seydou  est à son premier prêt et envisager réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 55.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider  les parents à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou was born in July 1988. He is unmarried and without children, and he lives in a traditional family in Fana, in the Banakabougou district, Commune de Guégnaka, Cercle de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (Republic of Mali). 

Mr. Seydou is established on his own and has had a business selling sewing supplies for two years now. He gets his supplies from Bamako every two weeks and makes his sales in Fana at the retail level, in cash and sometimes on credit. He owns a store on the roadside in Fana City. 

He is collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to organize his business better. He intends to use his loan to purchase packets of spools of thread, needles, buttons, and snaps. Seydou is on his first loan and envisions making a monthly profit of 55,000 francs CFA, which will be used to help his parents to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies for his store

loans.name: Gulinora

texts.ru: Гулноре 38 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Двое из детей совершеннолетние и двое не совершеннолетние. Гулнора имеет 2 га земли, где выращивает сено для скота. Она откармливает скот и получает от данного бизнеса доход для проживания. Гулнора также является ветеринаром. Она хорошо знает все тонкости своего дела. Гулнора является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж Олимджон имеет маленький доход. Гулнора хочет развевать бизнес скотоводством и таким образом получить больше дохода. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей высококачественными продуктами питания и выделять больше средства для их обучения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота для расширения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulnora is 38 years old. She is married and has four children. Two of her children are grown and two are still young. 

Gulnora has two hectares of land, where she grows hay for livestock. She fattens cattle and receives a living from this business. Gulnora is also a veterinarian. She knows well all the ins and outs of this trade. Gulnora is the main breadwinner for the family, as her husband Olimjon has a small income. Gulnora wants to develop her cattle business and thus to gain more income. 

From the resulting profit, she plans to provide her children with high-quality food and to allocate more funds for their education. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase cattle in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her business

loans.name: Corazones De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZONES DE ORO”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cecilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, costura de edredones, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cecilia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás con el primer préstamo que sacó de Pro Mujer, al observar que este producto se vendía ampliamente en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, verduras) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Corazones de Oro” (Hearts of Gold) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board presided over by Cecilia.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: blanket sales, food sales, blanket weaving, comforter sewing and vegetable sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Cecilia.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for four cycles having been invited by a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a food stand and she relates that she learned this several years ago with the very first loan she got from Pro Mujer when she noted that this product sold widely in the market.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy rice and vegetables in street markets in the city of El Alto and once she makes it will sell it in her sales stand.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home as possible since she’s in a common law relationship and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 37 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 2 hijos.  Carmen se dedica a la venta de comidas por las noches. Para eso instalará una mesa en el frente de su casa.  Está retomando éste negocio pues lo había dejado por problemas personales, ahora consiguiendo los implementas necesarios como platos, ollas y otros. Quiere ayudar a su familia con los ingresos, ya que su esposo no gane lo suficiente para cubrir gastos del hogar. Por tanto, viendo lo rentable que es su negocio, y los pedidos que tiene, desea empezar y continuar hasta hacerlo crecer. Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Está contenta de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para concretar  sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de utensilios para su negocio como ollas, vasos, platos, y otros, además de mesas y sillas, también ingredientes para la preparación de comidas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 37 years old, is married and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. Her business is selling food which she does at night on a table set up in front of her house. She had quit doing this business because of personal problems, now she will restart it. She needs to buy the necessary equipment like plates, pots etc. Carmen wants to help her family with some income as her husband doesn't make enough money to cover the household expenses. Given how profitable her business was and the amount of requests she receives, she wants to start again and make her business grow. 

With the requested 500 PEN Carmen will buy the utensils she needs for her business, such as pots, plates, glasses, etc. She'll also buy chairs, tables and ingredients to prepare her meals.This will be her first loan with Kiva and she is happy that she can count on this financial support to realize her goals. She promises to be responsible in paying her installments.

loans.use: to buy pots, glasses and plates for her restaurant.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 60 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, bread, chips, etc.

Lily has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending and farming rice.

Lily aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, bread, chips, etc.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Calca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS ROSAS DE CALCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Natividad ella es conviviente y tiene 33 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de leña, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de verduras.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “Las Rosas de Calca” (The Roses of Calca), which is located in the District of Calca, Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Natividad. She is 33 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children. Natividad works at her grocery business. She sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil. Natividad has a space at the market where her grocery store is located. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. Her business has been in existence for one year and it is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting a loan in order to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

The other members engage in businesses such as selling wool, selling food, selling groceries, and selling vegetables.

Natividad is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream in this manner. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Furkatjon

texts.ru: Фуркатджон добросовестный человек. Ему 47 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет одного сына, которому 17 лет. Фуркатджон более 3 лет занимается переработкой абрикоса. Фуркатчон справляется с бизнесом отлично. Его жена и сын помогают ему введению бизнеса. Его жена занимается купле продажей канцелярских товаров. Сын Фуркатджона в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Он учился в школе отлично и имеет большие планы в будущем. Фуркатджон должен оплатить за учебный договор сына, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Furkatjon добросовестный человек. He is 47 years old. He is married and has one son, who is 17. For more than three years, Furkatjon has been engaged in processing apricots. Furkatjon does his work excellently. His wife and son help him to run the business. His wife is engaged in buying and reselling stationery. 

Furkatjon's son graduated from high school this year and enrolled in university. He was an excellent student and has big plans for the future. 

Furkatjon needs to pay his son's tuition, but he doesn't have the money. He is requesting a loan of USD $1,100 to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s education at the university

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
LA JOVEN MARICRUZ ES UNA MAESTRA QUE RESIDE EN EL MUNICIPIO DE CONDEGA A UNO 35 KM AL NORTE DE LA CIUDAD DE ESTELI, ELLA ESTA FELIZMENTE CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS UNO DE ELLOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR.

 ES UNA MAESTRA ACTIVA QUE LABORA PARA EL MINISTERIO DE EDUCACIÓN DE NICARAGUA, IMPARTIENDO CLASE A NIÑOS DE PRIMARIA EN UNA ESCUELA  UBICADA EN EL CASCO URBANO DE CONDEGA, ELLA IMPARTE SUS CLASES DE 7 AM A 12 M DE LUNES A VIERNES Y POR LA TARDE ELLA PLANEA LAS CLASES DEL DÍA SIGUIENTE, ELLA TIENE UNOS TRECES AÑOS DE LABORAR PARA ESTE MINISTERIO DE MANERA CONTINUA SIENDO ESTE SU PRINCIPAL INGRESO FAMILIAR PARA PODER SUFRAGAR SUS GASTOS.

SE PRESENTA A CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN FINANCIAMIENTO PARA PODER SEGUIR MEJORANDO SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN LA QUE A IDO RE-MODELANDO CON EL TIEMPO A TRAVÉS DE LOS FINANCIAMIENTO ANTERIORES QUE LE A OTORGADO CEPRODEL.

 ELLA SE HA MOSTRADO AGRADECIDA CON LA AYUDA QUE LE HA FACILITADO CEPRODEL YA QUE SUS INGRESOS MENSUALES NO SON LOS SUFICIENTE COMO PARA PODER LLEVAR ESTE GASTO POR CUENTA PROPIA SINO A TRAVÉS DE FINANCIAMIENTO CON UN PLAZO CONSIDERABLE QUE LE PERMITA IR PAGANDO CON CUOTAS JUSTAS.

ELLA ESPERA SEGUIR MEJORANDO LAS CONDICIONES DE SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y ESPERA QUE EL CRÉDITO QUE ELLA SOLICITA LE SEA APROBADO Y DE ESTA MANERA CON EL TIEMPO LOGRAR DARLE EL TECHO DIGNO QUE MERECE SU FAMILIA Y MEJORAR SUS CONDICIONES DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Young Maricruz is a teacher that lives in the municipality of Condega, 35 km north of the city of Esteli. She is happily married and has two children, one of them school-age.

She is an active teacher, working for the Nicaragua Ministry of Education teaching primary school in the urban center of Condega. She teaches from 7:00 AM -12:00 PM Monday through Friday and in the afternoons she plans the classes for the following day. She has been working for the Ministry continuously for thirteen years. It is the primary source of income for her family to defray costs.

Maricruz approaches Ceprodel to request a loan to be able to continue making improvements on her home. She has been remodeling it over time with previous loans awarded to her by Ceprodel. She has been grateful for the help that Ceprodel has provided because her monthly income is not enough to cover these costs on her own. A loan with a considerable payment period allows her to pay over time in fair installments.

She hopes to continue improving the conditions of her home. She hopes that the loan she is requesting is approved so with time she will be able to give her family the home they deserve and improve their way of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tiessiri, est composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana,  préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font de la restauration, le commerce de condiments,  d’habillements, de savons et des articles divers.                                                                
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées. 
La cliente OUMOU  la deuxième personne à partir de la droite compte acheter des articles divers tels que 5 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako et 20 glacières de différents modèles.  Son cycle d’achat est mensuel. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et aider le mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The group called Tiessiri is made up of married women who are on average 32 years old and have an average of four children, all living in traditional extended families in the town of Fana,  prefecture of Dioïla,  Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) 

They met through ties of kinship, neighborhood, and friendship. They sell cooked food, condiments, clothing, soap, and various other items. These women from the group called Tiessiri are on their first solidarity loan which will be used to buy the merchandise mentioned above for resale. 

Oumou, the second person from the right, intends to buy various items such as five lengths of African print  "wax" quality cloth from Bamako and 20 coolers of various models. She restocks her goods monthly. She expects to make a monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and help her husband to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy various items for resale

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y ha procreado cinco hijos. Se dedica  a realizar los oficios domésticos de su casa a lado de sus 2 hijas mayores; también brindan apoyo  a los trabajos agrícolas, ya que tradicionalmente ella se desempeño desde corta edad  junto con su padre  y hermanos para las actividades agrícolas y ella a transmitido  ese mismo ejemplo a sus hijos e hijas.  


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 sacos de abono,  una caneca  de herbicidas y el  resto lo utilizara en el pago  de trabajadores  que le ayudan  a realizar las actividades agrícolas. La necesidad a satisfacer, será solventar  la compra de los abonos  e insecticidas para la actividad agrícola, con el fin de obtener mejores resultados a la hora de la cosecha.

La calidad de vida  familiar se vera beneficiada  de manera directa;  ya que  con la obtención del crédito  podrán solventar  las necesidades de insumos agrícolas  no dejando  expuestos los cultivos a desnutrición o plagas que afecten directamente y  les permitan obtener mejores cosechas para comercializar mayor cantidad.  

Los objetivos familiares a futuro  es poder tener la posibilidad  a  través del trabajo  de brindar a sus hijos mas pequeños que aun cursan la educación básica  la oportunidad de culminar al menos la educación media  y  así ellos tengan mas y mejores oportunidades de obtener un empleo.
texts.en:
María, 52, is married and has had five children.  She works doing her domestic chores alongside her two oldest daughters and they also help with the agricultural tasks since traditionally she started doing this alongside her father and brothers when she was still very young and she’s passed down this same example to her sons and daughters.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy four sacks of manure and a drum of herbicide and she’ll use the rest to pay laborers that help her with the agricultural chores.  The need to meet will be to buy the manure and insecticide for the agricultural activity in order to get the best results at harvest time.

Family quality of life will be directly affected because by getting the loan they’ll be able to meet the need for agricultural supplies and not leave the crops exposed to lack of nourishment or to pests that may affect them directly and they will be able to get better crop yields to sell in larger amounts.

The family future goal is to be able by means of work to provide for the youngest children who are still in primary school to be able to at least complete secondary school so that they will have better employment opportunities.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children who are in school, Elvira works hard to support her family. She has a business, selling vegetables in the Philippines. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Elvira is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional vegetables to sell, at her greengrocery stall. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Arroryo Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Trabajadoras de Arroyo Pora está en el 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras, donde cada una tiene una gran expectativa de mejorar su estilo de vida. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por sus hijos, para que tengan todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marina, ella tiene un Kiosco en su casa, y allí trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, y solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de golosinas, comestibles, bebidas, jugos y productos varios. Ella es muy trabajadora, y quiere salir adelante, es por eso que se está esforzando tanto al igual que sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres Trabajadoras de Arroyo Pora” (Working Women of Arroyo Pora) is in its first loan cycle with the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. Each member has great expectations of improving her lifestyle. These women are heads of households who strive on behalf of their children because they want to give them everything that they did not have.

One of the members is Sra. Marina, who operates a kiosk out of her home. She works every day and begins very early. Marina is requesting a loan so that she can invest in candy, food products, beverages, juices, and various other items. She is a hard worker who wants to move forward. For this reason, she strives to do her best, just like her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy candy, food products, beverages, juices, and various other items.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. She earns additional income from selling prepared foods.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional items to sell at her general store, like canned goods, milk, soap, and sugar.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell at her store, like canned goods, milk, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 36 years old, married, and has four children, who are in school. She is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for 3 years.

Melanie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business. In the future, Melanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has business selling rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years, and she earns additional income from prepared food vending and keeping a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional sacks of rice to sell, at her rice retailing business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Sorany

texts.es: Sorany, a sus 29 años de edad es madre cabeza de hogar, vive con sus dos hijos de 6 y 7 años de edad. Actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio, un pequeño salón de belleza que inició hace dos años, gracias a que una amiga suya le enseñó la actividad y desde entonces realizó diferentes cursos de capacitación en belleza; con esto ha logrado obtener ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Sorany es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora, con visión y ganas de salir adelante, su principal motivación son sus hijos, por eso solicita el primer crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de herramientas de trabajo (secador y plancha para el cabello) e insumos al por mayor (shampoo y acondicionador) con el fin de prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes que son familiares, vecinos y amigos del sector donde reside. Ella sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, para incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindarle a sus hijos una mejor educación y velar para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sorany is  a 29-year-old mother and the head of the household. She lives with her two children aged 6 and 7. She currently runs her own business, a small beauty salon, which she started two years ago, thanks to a friend who taught her the trade. Since then she has taken different training courses in beauty treatments, and, as a result, has managed to bring in enough income to support her family.

Sorany is a hard-working and enterprising woman with vision and drive to move forward. Her main source of motivation is her children, and this is why she is requesting her first loan so that she can invest in tools for work (hairdryer, straightening irons) and bulk supplies (shampoo and conditioner) with the aim of giving a better service to her clients, who are relatives, neighbors, and friends from the neighborhood where she lives. She dreams of growing her business in order to increase her income and be able to give her children a better education and make sure that they have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy work tools and supplies (hairdryer, straightening irons, shampoo, and conditioner)

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: Juan de 40 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hija en casa propia, es un hombre muy responsable, trabajador y honrado, trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan dulce, y sale a venderlo por la colonia donde él reside, Juan solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para él puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, age 40, lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He is a responsible, hardworking, and honorable man who works in his own bakery. Juan produces sweet bread, which he sells in the neighborhood where he lives.

He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of flour, shortening, baking tins, and everything else he needs to produce more. This goal of improving his bakery is very important to him since it means a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, baking tins, and other supplies.

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
Julián tiene 21 años de edad, esta acompañado y ha procreado una hija. Este joven se dedica  a  la agricultura desde que tenia unos 10 años de edad, pues con su papá, aprendió a trabajar, él siempre le decía que le serviría, cuando tuviera su hogar. Hoy que tiene su propio hogar, lo hace con mas voluntad para  tener siempre el sustento de su familia. Se levanta muy de mañana 4:30 am, para ir a  dejar una novilla que tiene, luego regresa a traer la comida para conducirse al trabajo, que le queda como a treinta minutos a pie,trabaja unas 6 horas y luego regresa a casa,para atender a su hogar y compartir con su niña de tan solo mes y medio. 

Para realizar sus compras, sale de su casa a pie y camina unos 45 minutos para llegar donde toma el autobús que lo conduce al pueblo, tarda el recorrido una hora, y luego de regreso.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cuatro toretes para repasto; ya que tiene el potrero, pero no tiene para comprar los toretes.

su sueño, es poder construir su propia casa de ladrillo, ya que la que hoy tiene es de lamina, a demás sueña con tener unas vacas lecheras, ver a su hija graduada en la universidad, ya que el no tubo esa oportunidad,
texts.en:
Julián, 21, has a spouse and they have a daughter.  This young man has worked in agriculture since he was 10-years-old for he learned to work with his father who always told him that it would be useful for him when he had his own home.  Now that he does have his own home he works even more willingly in order to support his family.  He rises very early in the morning at 4:30am to take a young heifer he has and then returns to bring food and head off to work which is about a 30-minute walk away.  He works about six hours and returns home to care for his home and spend time with his little girl who is only one and a half months old.  To make his purchases he leaves home and walks 45 minutes to the bus stop to go to town; the ride takes an hour and then he returns.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy four bullocks to put to pasture because he has the pastureland but doesn’t have the money to buy the bullocks.

His dream is to be able to build his own brick house since the one he has now is metal sheeting and he also dreams with owning dairy cows and with seeing his daughter graduate university since he didn’t have that opportunity.

loans.use: to buy 4 bullocks.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es una persona muy trabajadora, que emprende de todo para poder ayudar a su familia, dar a su hijo todo lo que necesita y que no tenga que pasar por ninguna privación. Este es su segundo crédito, y gracias al anterior pudo comprar para su maquina de hacer pollos al spiedo, y así pudo captar mas clientes.
Hoy solicita de nuevo un crédito para poder ampliar un local que adquirió y de esa forma seguir creciendo y también dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de nuevo de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Jose is a hardworking person who does everything he can to help his family, provide his son with everything he needs, and prevent them from having to endure any hardship. This is his second loan. With the help of his previous loan, Jose was able to buy a rotisserie machine for cooking chickens, which helped him to attract more customers.

He is now requesting another loan in order to expand the shop he acquired so that he can keep growing and also provide good service to his customers. Jose is grateful for this new opportunity he has received, which will be of great help once again.

loans.use: to pay for improvements needed to expand his food shop.

loans.name: Flores De Libertad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORES DE LIBERTAD”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Inés es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de fruta, trenzado de mantas, tienda de barrio, confección de busos, costura de chompas, venta de arvejas y habas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Inés es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de fruta; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa de su madre, que trabaja en el mismo rubro, posteriormente decide implementar su propio espacio de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las comunidades tropicales del Departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Flores de Libertad” (Flowers of Freedom) communal bank will start the seventh cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Inés.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: food sales, fruit sales, blanket weaving, neighborhood store, sweatshirt making, sweater sewing and peas and lima bean sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Inés.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for 8 cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s promoters that visited her at home.  She currently has a business selling fruit.  She relates that she started the business on her mother’s initiative who is in the same line of work and she decided later on to set up her own business space.

The loan she’ll take out now es to increase capital.  She will buy fruit in the tropical communities in La Paz Department and then sell it in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home as possible since she’s single and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the health services.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 67 años, está casado y vive en su casa propia junta su esposa.  Walter se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón a base de desechos de maderas de los aserraderos cercanos. Se inicio hace más de 30 años, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de sus hijos en la preparación y venta del carbón.Decidió en empezar con su actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sostener  a sus hijos, logrando sacarlos adelante brindándoles su educación siendo su mayor orgullo.
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo pues es su único sustento.
Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, se siente agradecido con el crédito recibido para continuar con su negocio y desea seguir contando con más créditos.  Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto  de 500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su material principal para la elaboración de sus carbones.
texts.en:
Walter, 67, is married living in his own house with his wife.  Walter works making and selling charcoal made from left-over wood from nearby sawmills.  He started over 30 years ago and to date does it with help from his children who help him make and sell the charcoal.  He decided to start this activity because he needed to have a source of income to support his children.  He succeeded in doing so and provided them with an education which is his greatest source of pride.

Seeing the good results he’s getting and the good profits he nets, therefore, he wants to continue with his business and to maintain it because it’s his only source of support.

This is his first Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the loan he’ll get to continue with his business and he wants to continue relying on more loans.  Because of this he commits to be punctual with his payments.

He will use the 500 new soles to buy the main raw material needed to make the charcoal.

loans.use: to buy wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha is 42 years old and married. She has seven children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane, among other business activities, in the Philippines. She has been cultivating sugarcane for 20 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling livestock, and food vending.

Alpha is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting an additional loan. She wants to further build her farming sugarcane, food vending and livestock businesses. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers, and other supplies for cultivating sugarcane

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children who are in school, Connie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a restaurant. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and restaurant businesses. 

Connie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, oil, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Connie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, oil, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María, a sus 52 años de edad es una mujer soltera y madre de un hijo. Durante más de 28 años laboró en diferentes empresas y obtuvo así los ingresos necesarios para sacar adelante a su hijo y brindarle educación, pero hace 7 años se quedó sin empleo y depende económicamente de sus familiares y su hijo. Ella vive con su padre, ya que su único hijo  de 34 años de edad vive fuera del país, pero manifiesta que no se siente bien siendo una carga para otras personas. María es una mujer muy dinámica y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y obtener los ingresos para su hogar por su propia cuenta, por eso se motiva para solicitar un crédito ya que desea iniciar su propio negocio de venta de helados y mecato, desea invertirlo en la compra de un congelador, adecuar su casa con una reja y comprar surtido (mecato, gaseosas, helados) para aprovechar que en la zona donde vive hay muchos niños y no existe un negocio que ofrezca los productos, así podrá generar ingresos para sostener a su padre y llevar el alimento a su hogar. María sueña con tener su negocio bien posicionado y que perdure en el tiempo, y poco a poco poder introducir más variedad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, who is 52 years old, is a single woman and has a son. She worked for different companies for over 28 years, which is how she obtaind the income she needed to provide for her son and give him an education. But seven years ago she became unemployed and depends financially on her relatives and her son. She lives with her father, since her only son, who is 34 years old, lives abroad. But she says that she doesn't feel good about being a burden for other people. 

María is a very dynamic woman and she is very eager to get ahead and bring home an income on her own. That is her motivation to request a loan, because she wants to start her own business selling ice cream and snacks. She wants to invest in purchasing a freezer, install bars in her home, and stock up on products (snacks, sodas, ice cream). This will make the most of the fact that in the area where she lives there are a lot of children and no businesses that offer these products. This will allow her to generate income to support her father and bring sustenance to her home. 

María's dream is to have a well-established and long-standing business. She would like to gradually introduce a wider variety of products in order to satisfy her customers' needs so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to start her business, buy a freezer, install bars in her home, and buy products (snacks, sodas, ice cream).

loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Dioleta works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut wine. Dioleta is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Dioleta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Perlas Doradas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLAS DORADAS”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: consultorio dental, costura de billeteras, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de coca, alquiler de vajillas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de billeteras; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás cuando aprendió la técnica de costura de estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la Ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Perlas Doradas” (Golden Pearls) communal bank will start the fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Angélica.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: dental office, wallet making, vegetable sales, neighborhood store, coca leaf sales and chinaware rental.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Angélica.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for four cycles having joined thanks to an invitation by one of the institution’s promoters that visited her at home.  She currently has a business making wallets.  She says she learned this business years ago when she learned the sewing technique for these products.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy leather at wholesale in stores in El Alto and after making them will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family the best way possible since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 30 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Verónica se dedica a la elaboración y venta de carbón a base de trozos de maderas de los aserraderos cercanos. Se inicio hace más de 06 años, y hasta el momento lo realiza con el apoyo de sus hijos en la preparación y venta del carbón.Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que les deja, así como la demanda que le permite vender todos su producción.
Se decidió en empezar con su actividad por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sostener  a su familia.Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados y las ganancias que le deja, desea continuar con su negocio y mantenerlo pues es su único sustento.Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto cuenta con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Con el monto de 500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su material principal para la elaboración de sus carbones.
texts.en:
Verónica, 30, is married living in her own house with her husband and three children.  Verónica works making and selling charcoal she makes from lengths of lumber from local sawmills.  She started more than six years ago and to date does so with help from her children who help her make and sell the charcoal.  She considers her business to be profitable because of the good profits she nets as well as the demand that makes it possible for her to sell her entire production.

She decided to start this activity because she needed to have a source of income to support her family.  Therefore, seeing the good results she’s having and the profits she nets she wants to continue with her business and maintain it since it’s her only source of support.  

This will be her first Kiva loan so she’s relying on your collaboration to continue towards her objectives.  On the other hand, she commits to be punctual with her payments.  She will use the 500 new soles to buy the main raw material to manufacture the charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal-making raw materials.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 30 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Maria se dedica al cultivo de Yucas, para eso cuenta con su propio terreno de 10 hectáreas, la cual está en crecimiento y una vez listo, los vende a los comerciantes de los mercados más cercanos de la localidad. 
Se inició con su propio capital, sembrando 1 hectárea y luego fue ampliando a más, viendo la demanda que tiene. Aprendió éste negocio de su padre. Comenta que se inició en éste negocio por el deseo de ser una empresaria y contar con sus propios ingresos. Logrando tener buenos resultados, ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y ampliar las extensiones de sembrío de yuca, así generarse más ingresos y atender otros mercados. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Se siente contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Por tanto, se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto de 800 nuevos soles los invertirá en abono orgánico para ampliar su capacidad de producción y poder atender la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old, married and lives in her own house with her husband and 5 children. Maria works in yuca cultivation, for which she has her own 10 hectares of land she is currently growing on. Once they are ready, she will sell it to the vendors in the closest markets.

She got started by planting 1 hectare using her own capital. Later she expanded, seeing the demand for it. She learned this trade from her father. She says she got started in this trade because she wanted to be a business owner with her own income. Having achieved good results, she now has plans to continue with her business, expanding her yuca planting areas. This will allow her to generate a higher income for herself and serve other markets.

This will be her first loan with Kiva. She is glad to know that she will have the financial support to go ahead with her plans and promises to be responsible with her payments. She will invest the sum of 800 nuevos soles in organic fertilizer to expand her production capacity and be able to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to expand her yuca production.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es: La Sra. Gumercinda sigue con la misma actividad de la Venta de comida, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en el mantenimiento de su vehículo,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas,  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Gumercinda continues with her food sales activity.  She relates that she did well with the previous loan that she used to service her vehicle.  On this occasion she requests the loan to buy ingredients to make her meals.  She feels happy and grateful for the business growth opportunity she’s being given..

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Chiradee Lian

texts.en:
Chiradee Lian is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, and she earns additional income by selling pre-paid mobile load, and raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell at her general store, like sugar, rice, and oil.

Chiradee Lian has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her general store, like sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny is 46 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Fanny is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to pay for laborer's salaries during harvesting and buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for the next plantation.

Fanny has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborer's salaries during harvesting and buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for the next plantation.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Francisca works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a cafeteria. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her restaurant and cafeteria business. Francisca is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Francisca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma works hard to support her family. Erma is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

Erma requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Erma has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Erma would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to puchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 52 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elisa is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets and feed.

Elisa has been raising pigs for 20 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Marilita

texts.en:
Marilita works hard to support her family. Marilita is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Marilita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Marilita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Marilita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Riccy Miriams

texts.es:
Riccy tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Riccy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de cerdos. 

Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos y semillas, además alimento para los cerdos como polvillo. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para el trabajo.
texts.en:
Riccy, 40, is in a common law relationship and has two children; she lives with her husband and children in Recinto Mina de Piedra belonging to Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She belongs to the “30 de Noviembre” (November 30) communal bank located in Recinto Mina de Piedra belonging to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Riccy works in agriculture growing corn and raising pigs.  She will be able to buy supplies like fertilizer, manure and seeds as well as pig feed like ‘polvillo’ [rice bran] with the loan.  She makes her purchases in the city of Ventanas.  Her dream is to buy land to work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pig feed.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 33 years old and married with two children.

Jenny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like sugar, oil, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Jenny has borrowed and paid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

Jenny aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like sugar, oil, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business, buying and selling peanuts in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years, and she earns additional income by growing peanuts.

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 59 years old and married with three children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like soft drinks, sugar and noodles to sell.

Violeta has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for six years and also earns income from a motorcycle transport business.

Violeta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, sugar and noodles to sell

loans.name: Nury Elena

texts.es: Elena es una mujer casada y no tiene hijos, a sus 43 años de edad se dedica hace 6 años a la fabricación de productos en arte country, actividad que aprendió en un grupo de madres comunitarias al que asistía; de esta forma adquiere los ingresos para apoyar la carga económica en su hogar. Actualmente trabaja sola, pero quisiera poder emplear una persona para que la apoye en el proceso inicial de pulir la madera. Elena se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, organizada y muy activa, siempre va en busca de oportunidades que le permitan salir adelante, por esa razón solicita el primer ciclo de crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de un compresor y materia prima al por mayor (madera MDF), con el fin de poder tener los insumos necesarios para cumplir con los requerimientos de sus clientes y darle una terminación perfecta a sus productos, así podrá vender más y generar más recursos para cumplir uno de sus principales sueños en un futuro cercano, que es montar su negocio en un local propio y dar clases sobre este arte a otras personas, lo que le generará ingresos adicionales y mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elena is 43 years old and is married with no children. For the last 6 years she has been making "country art" crafts, having learnt the skill at a community mothers' group which she attended. Through this she earns an income which helps towards the household expenses. Currently she is working alone but she would like to be able to employ someone to help her in the initial process of polishing the wood. 

Elena is enterprising, organised and very active and she always looks for opportunities which enable her to improve her life. This is why she is asking for her first loan with the intention of buying a compressor and buying raw material (MDF wood) wholesale. This will give her the necessary supplies to meet her customers' requirements and give her products a perfect finish. In this way she will be able to sell more and generate more funds to be able to fulfil one of her main dreams for the near future, which is to set up her business in a place of her own and give classes in this art form to other people. This will give her an additional income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and raw material wholesale (MDF wood)

loans.name: Leila

texts.es:
Leila tiene 50 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junto solo su esposo, ya que sus 3 hijos están independientes. Leila se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles desde una tienda instalada en su propia casa.  Lleva más de 06 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo ocasionalmente, quienes atienden cuando  está fuera de casa. Considera a su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la regular demanda que tiene desde que se inició en su negocio. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos y se siente ocupada. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir creciendo en su negocio,  ampliarlo vendiendo bebidas gaseosas y ropas. Esto será su primer préstamo con Kiva. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. 
Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías  como arroz y azúcar para su tienda, así también bebidas gaseosas y ropas.
texts.en:
Leila, 50, is married living in her own house with just her husband since their three children are independent.  Leila works selling foodstuffs in a store she has at home.  She’s been doing this for more than six years and to date her husband helps her occasionally when she’s away from home.  

She considers her business to be profitable because of the profits she nets and because of the steady demand she’s had ever since she opened the store.  She likes her business because it generates income and she keeps occupied.  Therefore, she wants to continue growing in her business and to expand into clothing and soft-drink sales.  

This will be her first Kiva loan.  She’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because now she’ll feel more sure of advancing with her business.  She will use the 1,000 new soles to buy merchandise like rice and sugar as well as soft-drinks and clothes for her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Marilou requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
